afMcoxTomBPf1EHH9Dcwvg.text: New gem in Vegas, not on The Strip!! D9bVRU4wCkQomnf4tVwarQ.text: Ok so we tried this place twice and the food was really good.  My review is for their unsafe food handling.  The first time we ordered Togo 2 forbidden rice bowls.  When we were picking them up we watched a cashier that handles money stick her bare unwashed finger in someone else's Togo order and move the food around, and then put the lid on and put it in the bag for the customer.  Luckily not us.  So I kind of ignored that and the following week only I ordered another forbidden rice bowl with chicken.  I got so sick that night and it has been 5 days now and my stomach still is a little off.  I can only attribute it to that bowl and then I remembered watching them stir a Togo with their finger!!  Yuck!  Food was great but no thanks.  Until they clean up their food handling we will not be back.

TxmvfwarsD9omz7dXNhZCA.text: Two stars for the blatant misrepresentation. Touting themselves as locally sourced, all natural (a meaningless marketing term anyway), and healthy, this "new age-y" eatery has many challenges. My biggest peve... their menu says, "Our proteins are naturally raised... because happy food makes healthy food."  Me to manager: Is the salmon farmed or wild caught?"  Mr Manager: It's farmed. Me: How is this natural? How is a constrained fish a happy fish? MM: The fish are raised in their own environment. They are just restricted. Me: Seriously? Ok, now you're just spinning words. I'm sure the restricted salmon are not "happy" salmon.  A note. The server asked if everything was ok. I showed her where it said "naturally raised". Her reply was word for word the same as the manager. Someone was coached.  The noise level was almost an intolerable cacophony. No sound-proofing materials on walls or ceilings.  So now the niceties. A lovely atmosphere visually with lots of pastels and artsie pieces. The patio is large and airy. The selection is varied.  I would recomend a visit to make your own decision.

MQbukcAFeJES0oho-HuEdw.text: My new food obsession. After eating, it feels like having great sex, you want more.  First of all, the people working there are young and scream positivity. The decorations are so fresh and vibrant, it feels like you are in California. I always need to wash my hands before eating and this place encourages you to do so, they have a sink you pass by only to wash your hands after you order food. Their patio area is so cute and they have shade. Their food is amazing! I recommend ordering a fresh coconut to go with your food.

3BSmH-U7SWvhIvIz5gNrKw.text: As a die-hard DTLV denizen, it takes A LOT for me to leave the comforts of Downtown Las Vegas. And I am not big on cutesy or overly curated establishments that focus on aesthetics vs. the food. Also, I have a thing with Summerlin...  That being said, a fancy friend of mine invited me to lunch once at Flower Child and I confess that I've been coming back ever since! I've had most of their small plates, with a couple of misses, but the Brussel sprouts, corn and quinoa and sweet potato were all very tasty. The sauteed broccoli is literally that (and costs 4 bucks for like 6 florets). The soups have all been very tasty, a standout was the chicken and rice. What blew my mind and I continue to order is a Thai cashew quinoa bowl with zucchini, snap peas, cashews, Thai basil, jalapenos and other goodies. OMG it is a flavor explosion, so tasty! I get it with salmon and feel quite good with myself (which is probably how the people in the neighborhood normally feel about themselves).

rFuc0Ao-exq1e7ImMVF6bg.text: Went on 6/8/2019 for lunch. This is a very chill and laid back restaurant. The atmosphere is mellow and it also has a nice covered, patio dining area. Plus the food is really good!!! Great location.

hFEdnP7y0_xVMmEibm7TEQ.text: "The Best Thing That Ever Happened to Summerlin"  I had to whip out the laptop to write this review as I was determined it was going to be the best review I will have ever written. I liken this place to the second coming of Jesus. I have never in my existence thought that healthy food could possibly taste as good as it does at Flower Child. Every. Damn. Time.  To put it into perspective, I've been here four times in the last month, twice in the last week. I've made it my personal goal for 2019 to try every single thing on the menu. My girlfriend says she would support me. That speaks volumes, because my girlfriend is not one who usually suggests eating out at a healthy restaurant. I LOVE this place. I love every single thing I have tried on the menu so far. This place has made me fall in love with tofu and seriously consider going vegan just for tofu. I doubt I would be successful though, because of my undying love for cheese.  The first time: Vegan poke- I feel like I was eating a poke bowl without all the guilt. I do not usually pick a dish with beets as an ingredient because I do not like the color of beets, but I was so glad I had this as my introduction to Flower Child, beet-colored poop and all. :)  The second time: "Forbidden Rice"- If this rice is forbidden, I would gladly go to prison to eat this for the rest of my life. This dish had so much flavor and so much healthiness that I would be willing to serve a life sentence just to eat it one more time.  The third time: Thai Dye- Spicy!! I would gladly shed tears just to have a taste of this spicy tofu wrap. Mouth and eye watering. We also shared the crushed avocado toast. Simple, yet very flavorful with the egg on top. I could probably make that at home, but I'd rather eat the Flower Child version.  Today: Brussels & Squash- Seriously, does this place have anything that doesn't taste good? This is my fourth try and I have yet to find anything that I don't like. I love the combination of everything in this dish. I was telling my girlfriend that whoever came up with this place, and this dish, is pure genius. Oh man.  I'm already thinking about the fifth visit and what I'm going to have. I'm thinking of the Flying Avocado for next time.

66qgjTlgKEbkcsWMcsNtuw.text: Great spot for a quick healthy tasty meal. Love the atmosphere and staff is always helpful. Try the glow bowl!

1zibMWhznA7cjhPbZF9VYQ.text: Overpriced hippie food. I do support and like the parent company Fox Concepts, but sadly I'd say this place was a disappointment for me. Sure the ambience is relevant and location is ideal but the layout and execution of the food is near catastrophic. Let's take the $7 avocado toast for example, this can be made at home on the same generic multigrain bread slice from any grocery store and still taste better...why not elevate the experience with a high quality bread slice that someone can't make at home. Other dishes tried were chicken tortilla soup (mostly a light broth overloaded with corn), and the vegan ingredient salad which showcased a Dijon mustard-y flavor beyond anything else. No thanks...2 people for lunch and $40 later, I'd rather enjoy their other sister restaurant next door - NorthItalia.

V9gmR5bi99GZHtJ2fN5A6Q.text: We're always in the boca park neighborhood and were so excited so try "Flower Child" the place looks welcoming and fresh! I came at 6pm hoping I wouldn't catch the dinner rush, there was no line and ordering was simple. I opted for the mix and match with grass fed steak, corn quinoa and a side of tofu. They have a little area with their own house made drinks and I was interested in trying them. I went over to the drink area but none of the flavors sounded appetizing but I did try the watermelon mango lemonade. The drink was okay but not a wow factor. The food came pretty fast but one at a time, I feel bad waiting for the other persons food. The avocado toast came and the presentation was off, it also needed a little more flavor. When my dish arrived I was SHOCKED at the portion, I had seen pictures online and it was way smaller than I even imagined. I could eat my steak in one bite! The corn quinoa was flavorful and paired well with the steak. As for the tofu, it had a weird texture and did not have any flavor, which is upsetting because I love tofu anything! I would not recommend coming here if you are looking to be full, its more of a snack or lunch time meal.

IA9cE2MzSDQ0XAmMizIB0Q.text: So I consider myself a flower child growing up in the generation that I did and have been looking forward to stopping in here for a bite. We had a lovely dinner here on Saturday evening.   Ordering is a breeze, you just walk up to the counter and let them know what you want, grab your number and find a place to sit down. When your dish is ready, a server will bring it out to you. Staff was not overly friendly but you don't have a lot of interaction with them except when you order. I did speak with a staff member while pouring my tea, and she was super outgoing and bubbly. She was educated and helpful with the tea selection.   The dining area is large and you can choose to chow down inside or opt for the patio dining which is what we chose. This place is so bright and airy. Great use of color through out the interior along with the groovy patio. You can't help smiling as you enjoy the good vibes emanating from this cafe'.  This cafe is primarily vegan but you have the ability to add protein to any meal. I chose the Strawberry Fields salad and added all natural chicken. The salad included organic strawberries, wild arugula, shaved fennel, toasted oats, dried mulberry, goat cheese, and the most delicious chia seed vinaigrette. It was a healthy choice for dinner and I also tried their Japanese mango sencha green tea.  My daughter tried the Flying Avocado wrap featuring smoked turkey, gouda, romaine, tomato and avocado hummus. We were both pleased with our meals. Everything tasted fresh and the produce was crisp. The avocado hummus was so tasty! The menu has such variety. They have salads, wraps, bowls and plates. For the kids, they have some healthy choices for them which you don't see often enough at restaurants. They also serve organic wine and some Nevada brewed beer as well.   I will definitely return here often so I can try more dishes from the menu. In addition, you can order food to go and they are offering e-bites!

kJlktu_ud2YcwmpKZuQyXg.text: Flavorful and healthy food.  I wish there was a way to know the ingredients to their sauces.  Overall, friendly environment and good food.  I have been here twice so far, tried their mother earth bowl and sweet potato noodle, both are tasty and reasonably priced.

fKWlyxHPj3KBMgHYbQftXQ.text: First let me say I really like the decor and the concept. The location is ideal as well. Dining in has never been too much of an issue. The price for what you get can be a little high...which isn't surprising. The mark up on healthy trendy food is actually really sad...  but this review is more about the take out and service.  We have ordered take out twice. Once we got the curried quinoa bowl and the second time each of us got the Mother Earth bowl. Both times portions were much smaller than what you get when you dine in. Presentation is pretty awful and unappetizing as well. My bowl was missing the pesto which is a staple in the dish. I called to see if I could possibly come back and the response that I received was a bit scary. "I'm not sure what you would like me to do? I can talk to a manager but I don't think we can take it back." I literally hung up the phone in disbelief. Who says that to a paying customer? Will I ever come back? Possibly to dine in, but their food isn't difficult to make at home. I am highly against ordering take out from this place. I'd rather eat a kashi quinoa bowl than the slop they throw in a container and make look like dog food, honestly.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut curry soup (vegan)
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curried quinoa (vegan)
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry quinoa with steak

qWiV7M7IpLVPewyCdyVf8g.text: I've only been here a couple of times, but Flower Child is one of those places I've recommended to nearly everyone I know! The fresh, healthy menu is perfect for hot summer days and anyone who cares about what they put into their bodies. They have tons of options for customizing orders or compatibility with specialized diets, with vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free logos on the menu, making it easy for everyone. Location is super cute and staff are helpful and friendly- when the line is out the door (their lunch rush is no joke!), they expedite by reserving tables in advance.   So far, I've liked everything I've tried- the Strawberry Fields salad is fresh and I love the addition of mulberries, the Thai Dye wrap with spicy tofu is perfect for Meatless Mondays, Skinny Cobb tastes better than the full-guilt versions elsewhere, and the avocado hummus is a must-get every time. Check out the bowls and plates if you have a heartier appetite.   I'm usually a water-only kind of gal, but this is one place I'll splurge for a drink- they have a variety of house-made concoctions with fresh fruit, no sugar, decaf, etc and they've all tasted great so far!

3UBiaG4_-4O-S2Qk6tijkw.text: I probably eat here three times a week. The food is always good and the staff is very friendly. They have quick service wether you eat there or get food for take out. Shout out to Daniel for ALWAYS being so nice and sweet. The only downside of flower child is they are always busy.... but clearly it's because they have amazing food and a great staff.

SabHz7horUfFMBnhzhgMmg.text: This place feels other worldly. Almost as if you're in a book. High quality healthy foods. Amazing staff. Location in Boca Park makes it the perfect lunch spot. Oh plenty of windows for natural lighting= glorious Instagram pics.

_vBrm6S48ouq5sUle_BfoQ.text: Came here for dinner with a friend sporadically after helping her with some stuff. This place is mildly away from where we live but i had been wanting to try this since finding out this place from another friend of ours.   Located on the NorthWest corner of Charleston and Ft Apache/Rampart, it sits next to Williams Sonoma on the north end of the shopping center.   Its a very casual place but you can tell the restaurant is run like a high class kitchen. Casual in a sense that you walk up to order and pay, and wait for your food to be delivered at your table, but high class that the kitchen is run with individual stations and timings. Flower Child has plenty of locations across the nation in 7 other states which is amazing and makes sense to be able to pull this size and quality off.   While waiting for our food, i had looked around noticing the details of the place. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Some under a small lip with umbrellas, some under a complete cover with fans. I hope one day we can come here when we have one of those rare beautiful days out and sit outside !   Menu has similar starts, salads, plates (pick one/two/three), bowls, and wraps. Selection of housemade drinks, nevada beers, and wines to pair as well !   As a fan of strawberries, the "Strawberry Fields" had caught my eye. With it including organic strawberries, wild arugula, shaved fennel, toasted oats, dried mulberry, coconut, goat cheese, and a chia seed vinaigrette AND opt'ed for an additional of some salmon to it too, i had liked it more than i had expected.   Light, bright, and flavorful vinaigrette tossed salad with a nicely cooked piece of salmon, it was pretty yummy ! I wanna copy this at home XD goat cheese was surprisingly mild but creamy. Dried mulberry and oats added a nice crunch. Wished for more shaved fennel and coconut as it seemed like they were quite rare in my dish.   My friend had gotten the "Forbidden Rice" which includes black pearl, red japonica, snap pea, bok choy, broccoli, carrot, onion, toasted sesame, red chili hoisin w/ choice of adding shaved beef or chicken (at additional cost).   Typically not much of a fan of anything but white jasmine rice, and having not so good of a history with wild rice or anything in that nature, surprisingly, this was pretty decent. With the "typical asian flavors of sweet and spicy", overall it tasted nice.   My friend and i both wish it was closer to us but its not too bad for me. I don't mind swinging over here once in a while to pick it up for lunch for us. This was like the higher quality version of Cafe Zupas for me but gave a bit more of a lasting impression ! dang now im hungry...

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry fields w/ salmon
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forbidden rice w/ shaved beef

XWKn3Wi6qnuPnytw8t2pzw.text: So nice to find a healthy place for a delicious meal!  The three of us absolutely loved the food an ambiance.  I had a Mediterranean chicken salad - so delicious.  You will not regret going here and the prices are super reasonable. Quick, healthy and delicious - must try.

kWdZn9g_s9LzoMqjVD9ClA.text: I had to circle the lot to find a spot there was so ch a crowd visiting Flower Child. Stepping inside I was instantly put at ease. How cool! Walking in felt like I was in a Local Co-op. Ordering was easy. We got our number and sat outside under the covered patio. Hardly any time passed and our food arrived.  I was a little trepidatious about the menu as I've rarely had a great vegetarian meal, this one was awesome. We split a pair of bowls. We had the Forbidden Rice and the Thai Cashew Quinoa. Both were delicious. The Forbidden Rice had a great flavor with the soy sauce balancing out the textures and flavors.  The Thai Cashew Quinoa had a little bit of heat, make sure you have the water ready. All the bowls were awesome. My only regret was that the bowls weren't bigger. I may have to add some protein next time I'm there.

xFdpUnmIR6HZiyGj_Ptl4w.text: Flower Child is probably only the second vegan-friendly restaurant we've visited on our trip so far, but it's already a favorite! For context, though, I'm not vegan myself; my sister is, so I can't really review from that perspective.  Anyway, I really loved the atmosphere and decor and all that; it felt very calm & refreshing. I didn't take as many photos as I would've liked, but I wanna note that there were lots of windows, so I loved all the natural light coming in.  I ordered the Flying Avocado wrap and a lemonade, and both were great! I especially liked that there were 2 different lemonade flavors to choose from, and both flavors seemed pretty unique since I'd never heard of either one before. If I'm remembering correctly, I think the first one was some sort of floral/rose type flavor (I tried that one) and the other was apple spice, I think.

nlr4f4liHAARKr98N4YAVA.text: Finally on this side of town and I get to enjoy this new and amazing restaurant, and I knew it was amazing before I went. It is intuition of course. The restaurant was very welcoming like the sort of atmosphere that you would go to moms and have dinner after being away for a while. The service here is stellar and so is the restaurant itself! The chairs and tables are so quaint and homey.   I ended up ordering the chopped veggies salad and the strawberry fields salad. For only $8 the portions are so large. I spilt two salads between myself and my twins, with extra left over. We also ordered the side orders simply sauteed broccoli. The broccoli sides were done to perfect and everything was so fresh. My favorite was the strawberry fields salad the strawberries were fresh and I paired it with a NV IPA beer. Magnificent is all that resonates with this hot new business!

m1LqmiD3SAaYnS-UeoRAvg.text: Amazing new spot that I can take my friends to when I want something "light". This place is clean and trendy, and perfect for those who love to take photos of their food- their food presentation is excellent.   I had the Viet salad with tofu- never had tofu with my salad but it was an amazing combo! My mother got the forbidden rice with shaved beef and she loved it. My sister ordered the Thai wrap and it was good- just wish that the wrap was a little thicker (it came really skinny).  I also ordered the Avocado Hummus as suggested on yelp and I'm so glad I did.. it's so good! As for pricing, it may be a few bucks more than regular places but it's well worth cause you're getting quality food. You can tell that the ingredients are fresh just by looking at the dish, and when you taste it you can confirm your assumption.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My viet salad with tofu was soooooo delish! Never thought I could survive a meal without meat but this made it possible

Ys7bEtwCdWUPLu6CUUVO1A.text: I fell in love with this place when I tried it in Scottsdale. So excited that it's finally in Vegas. Everything from the minute I walked in to my very last bite of food was great. We were greeted immediately as soon as we entered. The food was fresh & tasty. I loved the vegan cauliflower soup & Thai crunch salad. Avocado toast was yummy. My husband had the turkey Gouda wrap. I love that after our meal we didn't feel Bloated or heavy! This will def be my go to spot

VJq1Lx48OGgj-z47B-GK2Q.text: I am pregnant and was craving a nice salad so when I saw the salad selection, I was so excited. I ordered the Cobb salad with so many toppings that my mouth was watering and tomato toast for myself and tofu, mac n cheese, and fruit for my son.   I know I'm hormonal but I nearly cried when I got my salad. It was a huge bowl of arugula with literally two almonds, two slices of cucumbers, and a measly slice of avocado. The toast was tiny and completely burnt. My kids food was fine but just a few bites of food. The only thing wasn't a tiny portion was the salad but like I said, it was 99% arugula. With delivery and tip it was over $30 and we basically got a snack. All in all, I think I received about $8 worth of food. Not worth it at all.

rVI97LSbJ6eoIVE6_6x7Zw.text: Such a great place! I came here after my workout and this food definitely hit the spot. I chose to get a 3 item plate with steak to be my protein. I don't normally like medium rare meat but it was really good! A must have is the mashed potatoes, they were absolutely delicious! They also got the food out pretty quick which is awesome because I did not want to wait like 20+ minutes.

P7yJ0xspXREvYg8Oo8qkUA.text: This is the new neighbor to one of my favorite places, so I was excited to give it a go. As you enter, you're met by a combination of frenetic energy and pleasing decor. The menu has a lot going on and offers lots of options for vegetarians (while still providing some meat choices). The staff is super friendly and helpful. And the food is ready fairly promptly without sacrificing quality or freshness.  However, I would recommend they clarify ingredients. They offer two soups: one clearly states mushrooms (among other things) while the other, an Indian curry with lentils, lists what I thought were all the ingredients (sans mushrooms, which is what I was looking for). Unfortunately, the soup arrived at the table,  fragrant and full of mushrooms. I counted two lentils. So I think Flower Child should list their ingredients clearly, particularly for those who might have allergies, in this case to said mushrooms, and also offer two distinct soups, with less shared ingredients. Also, they should probably dip the ladle deeper into the pot since this lentil soup was lacking lentils.   All that aside, everyone was very nice about replacing it. We traded it for the avocado toast, and that was delicious. The black sesame is a nice touch. We also shared The Rebel wrap which has grass-fed steak, onion, cheese, arugula, and a nice flavor. (I would recommend that the cheese is evenly dispersed on the wrap - my half had no cheese, the other had all the cheese.)   Flavors were good and the place interesting enough to warrant another visit. We left with a gf lemon olive oil cupcake, and that was tasty. Thanks to everyone for making the soup situation right.

A0J9YYXlDwZOcj34xRxNjw.text: Walk in -- menu up top. Place and pay for your order with the cashier at the front and you're provided with a number to bring to a table. Water cups by the drinks. The entire place is spacious, with covered outdoor seating, as well. If the weather is nice, it would be super nice to sit out there.   Didn't expect to really really like my Mother Earth dish. I got the Mother Earth with grass fed steak (medium only). Thoroughly enjoyed Mother Earth. More than the steak surprisingly.   I also tried some teas but none of them really caught my attention so in the end, stuck with my usual jasmine tea. Also wanted to try their fresh juice but $7.50 for it hurts. Maybe one day.   On my second visit, opted for the Forbidden Rice with shaved beef. It was pretty good, although, I prefer Mother Earth more. Making it my goal to try something new every time I come.   Really wish it was closer to where I live/work. Would come here every week.

6NeJIjaKMK5YhounaqHgPQ.text: This was our first visit. I really liked the decor inside. And the food was very good and fresh! The kitchen is open so you can see what everybody is doing. Everything is fresh and not in bags. We are definitely going to return on many occasions lunch and dinner.

SY2Qj9lQ6iTt-1_B6jcbQw.text: Thoroughly enjoyed this spot, I got the avocado and the gluten free mac and cheese and it was pretty good. We sat on the patio which was pretty low energy, perfect for us to get some work done. The cashier, Sarah I think, was very sweet.

fmYK1QRJXvBvgWHb0Jx6jw.text: I have mixed feelings about this place.   The food itself is delicious. The negative part is the portions are extremely TINY! I also didn't care for the price for such small portions. For the price I paid, I felt like I should have gotten a. decent meal, when in reality it felt like I got 2 half-portioned sized appetizers.  Greens and Proteins is much better in my opinion.

LP1ALz0-END_j7Q2LXP3Pw.text: I want the owners to know that I'm moving from Henderson to Summerlin just so I can be closer to this delightful, delicious restaurant. I'm not joking.  FINALLY a Vegas restaurant that prepares fresh, tasty, and healthy dishes. The food is fantastic -- bold flavors and balanced textures. So happy to see playfulness and diversity on a menu. We have been in serious need of something like this.   Decor is perfect, the atmosphere is relaxing and charming.   This is a perfect restaurant.   The Rebel was just a tad bit salty...my only criticism.   Update: this is still my favorite place to eat at. Forbidden rice is out of this world!! Mac and cheese also very very good!

P2yipc9uyQvkJz-yuWwh0A.text: Flower Child hit the spot today. I had a chopped salad with tofu. My friends had the strawberry salad with chicken and brownie and lemon cake. My salad was perfectly dressed - meaning it had just enough dressing to cover it. For most, it might seem a bit under-dressed, but I like mine that way. I wasn't a fan of the avocado dressing, but it wasn't bad. I might try a different dressing next time.   The only reason I didn't give a five star is because for $4, I got probably 3 oz of tofu, which isn't a lot. I had to pay $8 to tofu... and that seems a bit outrageous, considering 18oz of organic tofu cost less than $2. So, my salad cost $16 for a regular bowl due to the double tofu. I could go to Wolfgang pucks and get an amazing salad for $20 with wild salmon on the side. At Flower Child, if I had gotten a side of salmon, it would have cost $15 which is less than what I paid with double tofu. Even if they had to grill it. There really isn't much to do. It's a better deal for salad if you don't get tofu and get chicken or something else.   Otherwise, I think this is a great place. Everything seemed fresh, and the staff were super friendly. I'd go back, but would make  different selection.

qb03uNQAoAMgu4QrJ_UE7g.text: Flower child is a new unique addition to the Summerlin area. The concept is very California and totally enjoyable. The food is very good and even some items fantastic. There will never be enough healthy restaurants in our area that taste great and have an enjoyable atmosphere. Try this place!  There is a poster of Twiggy on the wall in the dining room that just shocked me. Life is great and enjoy the flower children.

mJ_1wPHYyfhoarkbYCU5bw.text: Flower Child is my new favorite! I've been going at least twice a week since I discovered it. Such amazing options and such a diverse menu with every diet to choose from including low-carb, vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free menu options. I generally get the 2 or 3 side plate and add a protein and I am always more than satisfied. I have been wanting to try the wraps, but haven't gotten around to it...they do look amazing though from what I have seen through the open kitchen concept at Flower Child. The restaurant is beautiful and the teas are great as well. My favorite sides are the brussel sprouts, green beans, and the sweet potatoes. They all have great flavor! My only complaint is that the proteins are extremely plain and lack flavor so I always have to ask the kitchen for some sort of dipping sauce...so my tip would be to skip out on the protein or ask for the sauce like I do until they update their seasonings/marinade.

baqNCgZRZTfljnfqDDPYRw.text: Love the atmosphere, the food, the great service. Staff are very attentive, and accommodating. A place to bring friends or family, something for everyone. You will not disappoint. Fresh kombucha on tap as well. Highly recommend

W2kmNJ0a-o6bWp9FbzuemA.text: Okay... Worth the drive; well worth the drive. Fun, funky & fantastic. My Doc told me "no gluten and no dairy" about 4 years ago. Frequently, when I dine out, I take extra care when ordering to follow doctor's orders. Here? It's a synch. Terrific menu with great selections. This is a new go-to spot, even though it's 20 miles away from my home.

eHWlp6E9hi4ZVX-r1n-j4w.text: The food look good and smells good, but I would not call food full of dairy in it, healthy. Everything has some type of cheese on top to give a little bit more of taste. The lemonades are very good. The portions are small, I guess that's the healthy aspect of it. The avocado toast has a very thin layer of avocado and a lot of eggs and cheese. I was disappointed. For the ingredients and amount of calories I could go to north Italy across the parking lot. At least there I am not being lead to believe that I'm eating healthy when I am not. Lol

O1xZF-ITQY5F0atdlJ2pNA.text: This place is a great place for Family and friends who seek eating healthy delicious foods! I loved my first time I was with friends and our kids- we will be back many more times! Thank you

R4ahQh_msf4rn3MoHAq2Yg.text: Didn't have a chance to look at the menu before coming here so I didn't know what to expect. I came for a team building lunch with a couple people from work. We got there around noon and parking was terrible. I would recommend ride sharing when coming so you can get dropped off right in front. Normally I'm not a fan of restaurants that have you order before and then find a table, but they made it super easy and helped us find a table outside. I ordered a plate combo with Mac and Cheese, Asparagus and Salmon. To drink I went with the seasonal basil lemonade which was delicious. Everything on my plate was good, but next time I will get the asparagus without the ginger. This was probably the best salmon I ever had -- it was cooked perfectly. Restrooms were clean and private and the decor overall was super cute. I would definitely go back!

wzFAH6HsrfkHVF2lfBgETg.text: OMG! I totally didn't want to go here but once I got my food, my mind was changed. I can't believe that I didn't want to go. The food was fresh and so good. I've already gone back once for take out.

Healthy food for a Happy Family!!

RVWGvNhWdARsBGlmuih65A.text: What a beautiful and spacious restaurant. It also had outdoors seating and cute flower decorations all around, which I liked. The style of the restaurant reminded me of ones I would find in California, with a focus on healthy and vegan foods. The service was good and so was my wrap. I will be returning soon to try some other things. I'm especially interested in the four set, I believe, of veggies and other things.

tvZdhvK6MWXg3naNwFFVgQ.text: We need more restaurants like this in the valley!! Ordered take out on a Saturday, just before noon, due to how busy the restaurant  was. I had the chicken wrap and it did not disappoint; it was full of flavor and just simply delicious. I also had the soup of the day which happened to be tortilla, I may skip this addition if it's offered to me next time, I received 1 sliver of chicken and the soup lacked salt. Despite the bland soup, the chicken wrap was so good that the meal still gets 5 stars. There are so many options & combinations. I cannot wait to try the entire guilt-free menu.

b3dSr18N9ztNy9KGAb9NXg.text: This place was so cute. It is very spacious and has great ambiance. You can sit either indoors or outdoors whichever you prefer and our food was out pretty fast. I enjoyed their steak as well as their green beans along with a glass of Prosecco. The customer service was great as well. The vibe is very chill and is a great place to have a family gathering. I will most likely return here for future brunches and just meeting up with my girls.

nkBFyI43tiQlvDHE3W-q2A.text: Not a place to eat if you're hungry. Two meals later I'm finally full. Good quality food. The crowd is hilariously typical.

6M2Zo8bgKrM78sixfRHZTw.text: I saw this place and figured I'd give it a try. I went to pick up an order for lunch and bring it to work. It was really busy at lunch time, but the service was amazing. A lot of times new restaurants when they first open aren't as organized, but this place really surprised me. I got the avocado wrap and a drink. There were a lot of teas and lemonades to choose from that they make, and it was delicious. The wrap was super yummy as well. I am definitely going to have to make this place one of my go to spots for lunch!

5pvG4MO83pqYccR3q0fB2A.text: I have been here once and would go back and recommend this place to those who try to eat healthy.  There is something for everyone with vegan options and gluten free options.  The prices are the only thing I could complain about.  I paid almost $8 for a single piece of avocado toast with a soft boiled egg on it.  I would feel like I even got a better deal paying $10 for a 2 piece order.  I could make this meal at home with all organic ingredients for half the price.  The rose petal lemonade was delicious!  I would go again and explore more cost effective options like the choices of multiple small plates for a set price.

Wvx2bC5H1VK2504aAUQk5Q.text: Fresh and healthy food. Portion sizes are perfect. The lemonade selection is really unique and tasty.

MU0Gi4fCny8kha7DROGOOQ.text: You order at the counter and then have your food brought out to you.  The staff were all friendly and accommodating.  Definitely going for a healthy and organic vibe, so there's something for everyone.  The decor is nice.  It is kid friendly.  The food was great.  I had the steak salad.  I recommend it as a great lunch spot! I believe they also have beer and wine.

tdeyplPYdHHo60T6a96qMg.text: Omg this place is amazinggggg! I love EVERYTHING about it! The food, the decor, the set up, etc.  I feel in love with the place immediately!  I ordered:  1. Forbidden Rice Bowl (9/10)  2. Sweet Potatoes (10/10)  3. Green Beans (10/10)  4. Rose Petal Lemonade (10/10)   My ratings are VERY honest! I'm going back REALLY soon!

rsruqio96Dh8xcSdQQEUog.text: This place is sweet. It's like modern Italy - a quaint lunch spot with outdoor seating (dogs are welcomed) and an array of fresh vegetarian food. It's made with real ingredients. Yum. We had the Mother Earth Bowl (awesome), avocado hummus (why didn't we think of that!?), the Strawberry Fields salad (super fresh with coconut and toasted honey crunchies) and a small plate of smashed garlic and thyme potatoes. All these were so good. Definitely coming back and bringing the puppy.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

15clSr6rRiGiY4CYTutwBw.text: I was so impressed with this new restaurant in Summerlin. Having lived there my whole life, this restaurant is just what the area needed. Something fresh and healthy, and a fun place to go with friends and family. The decor is so lovely, and couldn't help but put a smile on my face. I ordered the avocado hummus and the kale salad with chicken. While the meat portion was small, it was cooked perfectly and went great with my salad. Make sure you grab some of their rose petal lemonade, you won't regret it. I can't imagine coming home and not making this restaurant a priority visit.

Bu-RtQDItpg1RczdDMA_YQ.text: Ok everyone eats at this place and as I work my way through the menu, I cannot figure out why!   I always ask what the most popular dishes are, and I have found them all disappointing- very little meat and everything is sweet which I don't like. 0syKHEgCiPbEupATyn_8rg.text: I was super excited when this restaurant opened. I love healthy options and this place is just beautiful. Unfortunately, our food and our experience was lack luster.   When my husband & I came in the front was very unorganized. People just kind of standing around everywhere not knowing where to order, if they needed to seat themselves or what was going on. We waited about 10 mins just waiting on people to figure out what they were doing and order before we could get to the woman taking orders. The girl was not very welcoming and didn't even really greet us. She just stood there waiting for us to tell her what we wanted.   The restaurant was about half full when it comes to occupancy. We waited fifteen minutes for our food to get to us, which was fine but all of our food did not come out. I actually had to look at our receipt to make sure the order was correct, which it was. We ate what we had for another 10-15 minutes and after no one brought us the rest of our meal I had to actually walk up and ask where the food was. The waitress I stopped apologized and got us the rest of our order fairly quick and she was very kind.   When it comes to the food everything was good, except for the beets my husband had in his bowl. They tasted like straight vinegar, so we had to push those to the side. I got the steak, garlic mashed potatoes, Mac & cheese and the Parmesan broccoli. Everything was actually incredible, except for my steak. First off it was extremely small, like 3 oz worth of steak and I know my portion sizes. Also, the cashier stated it was be cooked medium but it came out well done and chewy. The drinks here are really good. I really loved their teas!   Overall I'm not sure if I'd try this place again. I love the decor, the ambience and some of the food but my overall experience just missed the mark. Having a healthy option in town is great, especially since my husband & I are heavy in the health/fitness world competing, personal training & him running a local nutrition store but I feel like it's just not worth the time or price to come here. I expected a lot more.

8vzbT6iti0lBEex3i7mS9g.text: Decided to come here since some members of my family were on a diet - this place is great if you are on one. Healthy and delicious, but you can still stay on track with your macros. I'm going to say it straight, the flavor is BIG, but the portions are SMALL.   The restaurant itself has such beautiful decor. Hip and modern. It's great that you walk up and order your food, given a number, and you pick a table. So much better than waiting around waiting for servers. Water is self serve as well as utensils. Yes, food comes out quick!   Drinks - mostly teas and lemonades. Most sound amazing! I have to say the teas are on the bitter side because no sugar is added. Totally natural. The Lemonade is more on the sour side.  Food - like I said previously, the food is BOMB. So much flavor, you wonder how they do it and still keep it healthy. I got the Strawberry Fields salad with added chicken - which comes out to about $13-14.  The salads are a generally bigger portion since you're getting so much greens - so definitely more filling than the plates. The rest of my family members opted for the protein and sides  (these can go up to $15+). If you order the steak you only get 4 pieces (4oz approx) and for the chicken approx 6 pieces. We had a plethora of sides. Broccoli parmesan which you don't really taste parmesan, red glazed sweet potatoes - on the sweeter side, cauliflower - crispy and delicious. Can't really go wrong with the sides.   I'd come here if I'm willing to go for something more on the vegetables and good carbs and take a hit with protein. The price kind of will keep me away since it won't fill me up.

yYYKg7ktMvlsTKqCa17Khw.text: I've been going to flower Child for six months this restaurant seemed be better when they first opened recently I have been disappointed with the quality of the food when we received our dinner I brought it to the managers attention our meal was Cold the manager said I'll rewarm it for you he brought the food back and it was still cold then he said let me make you a new meal within three minutes he brought back the same food very disappointed in the customers Service we ate our meal the chicken was dry the rice which is normally delicious was like eating small rocks not likely to return I can get the same thing at Whole Foods in the frozen Food section.

t2xVFbJtPT0zzCvAriEi-w.text: Gluten free friendly!!! Fresh food that is delicious!! Plus they serve wine  with outdoor seating is available too!

U9DX91cYuQJiJ-Zye9pHjA.text: It took me about a year, but I was finally able to make it to this restaurant.  I was so impressed after the first visit, I've been back a number of times.  I've only tried the Thai Dye wrap because it's so good, I order it each time I return.  When I take my children, they enjoy the steak from the children's menu.  It does look pretty darn tasty.  My mother is in town visiting, so we stopped by for lunch.  She ordered the salmon and cauliflower.  She said it was so good, that she wants to return next week, before she flies back home.  The counter service is quick.  They keep the floors and tables clean, even though it's a very busy lunch spot.  Employees are all over the place, bringing food & keeping the restaurant clean.  They are also friendly and whisk your dirty dishes away when you're finished with them.  There aren't a lot of healthy places in my neighborhood to eat.  This place does not have the typical menu and has a lot of options to choose.  I also appreciate that they have stevia available for their iced tea.  I always forget to bring my own and most places only offer Splenda type sweeteners.  On my previous visit, the employee taking my order made a personal joke.  I hadn't been there for at least a week so I was surprised she remembered me.  This is a top-notch quick, healthy lunch spot in Vegas :)

ElOBb7BsR4k6238hiuVX6w.text: I have really enjoyed the food here but my last two visits have left me feeling disrespected and disappointed. My second to last visit I ordered a side of chicken for my salad, which costs around 5$. They forgot to bring the chicken back to my table, so I calmly reminded our server about it. Still, no chicken 20 minutes later. After that, I went to the woman who took our order and reminded her about the chicken. Another 15 minutes passes and still no chicken. At that point I was tired of reminding them about the food that I ordered, so my girlfriend and I left.   At our next visit I presented the receipt and told the employee taking my order (glasses, dark hair, female) about our last visit. She was extremely unpleasant. Reluctantly she decided she would give me an order of chicken. She didn't apologize and was the definition of rude. Our chicken did come but then my keen girlfriend noticed her salad was without avocado, which is one of her favorites. I get up yet again to inform our server we're missing avocado. He informs us that they're out, which the lady at the cash register failed to inform us. He was polite enough and asked if he could replace it with anything but I declined. I'm a very reasonable individual, but this is just unacceptable. I have worked in the food industry and have never treated paying customers in such ways. I'm not sure why the woman at the cash register was so rude and pretentious. It's baffling as I'm an extremely nice guy. That's what makes it worse. Going forward I'll be voting with my dollar and avoiding this place. In the spirit of being objective, the food we did receive was delicious. However, I can't subject myself to this place any longer. Hopefully management can prevent some of these issues going forward. Thanks.

EhDUpy5nzSE9YiVufhSN1A.text: Great location! Always busy but the food is quite delicious. I've only been here a couple of times so I obviously like it. They have heating lamps outside so it makes it feel good when cold to sit outside. They have sinks outside where you can see employees wash their hands and you can wash them too which is pretty cool if you pay cash. Their chamomile tea is very good and really helped me relax. Their honey is deliciously fresh. I definitely look forward to trying other items.  Their Mac and cheese was yummy and their wraps are yummy too. They are friendly to all diets which is cool.

U6ZqWd2dYaG7MgxE5YF_rw.text: I really wanted to like this place based off previous reviews and the price point. If we are basing my experience strictly on food I would have given them one more star. Why didn't I complain or ask the waitress to cook it a bit more... That is where things go down hill. When I first walked in I told the lady behind the counter that I have never been to this restaurant before, normally that's when you maybe explain a little bit or give suggestion, no she was like let me know what you want to order (which it's walk up order then sit which was also not explained.) Then after seating myself I went to the bathroom which was trashed, I was going to tell the girl who brought my food when I got back to my seat but she just put the food down in a hurry and walked away. I needed silverware which she ran to grab but again tossed on the table and walked away. I was never asked if I wanted a drink which I myself had forgotten to mention so I found the water station at the end of my meal. I just couldn't eat that chicken so I walked up where the food was being prepared (a spot I knew wasn't meant for me but come on the waitress kept avoiding my table) and asked for a to-go box which was met with one person ignoring me and the other handing it over as if I was an annoyance. SERVICE. It's as if we've all forgotten what that is! Price: good Portion size: ok Taste: good but Service: terrible and that's enough for me not to want to go back.

cVE4PINeVjmRfdT7RK6s1w.text: If I could, I'd rate this restaurant a solid 3.5 stars. It's a really nice restaurant, pretty decor and food was good! _VMxtXmHjCzyKgjLwOumYg.text: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed this restaurant and plan on coming back soon. The atmosphere was very nice and everything was very clean. The staff was very polite and respectful. When the meals came out they both looked great! We were both surprised; just like a lot of the advertisements restaurants strive for. They both tasted great. I read some reviews about the food being bland or flavorless, but I couldn't disagree more. So many restaurants look for excuses to add sugary, salty, or fatty ingredients to improve taste, but as far as I'm concerned just add calories. Maybe these people would be happier with fast food. All of this wasn't the case here. Both of our dinners didn't seem to have any unnecessary additions, but rather just the right balance of wholesome ingredients. I'm very conscious of my health and diet and this is the type of thing I'd strive to make for myself at home given the time and ingredients. The only downside was that it was a little more expensive than I was expecting, nothing egregious, but worth mentioning. Will be visiting again.

VHZXXD46MXNu0mvcbgS9rw.text: Happen to be in the area and wanted to try something new. Been trying to eat better and this synced up with it, so we stopped in. Lots of options on the menu, which is awesome! It can definitely get pricey if you start adding protein but no more than any other sit-down restaurant.  After checking out the reviews here, I couldn't not get the avocado hummus. It's pretty darn tasty though the bread-to-hummus ratio could be better with more bread. The hummus itself was hearty, fresh and a wonderful blend of several different flavors. I'm pretty sure it's made with witchcraft, but the jury's still out on that one.  I chose the wild mushroom pho and added shredded chicken for my main dish and the fresh flavors continued. The broth was a bit plain compared to pho from Vietnamese restaurants but this was still a tasty bowl of liquid sunshine. The other downside was I'm used to pho proportions; this was a bit smaller than a standard pho bowl.  The fresh taste of all the ingredients is really what makes this place stand out, and on a nice day the patio seating can be delightful. If I'm in the neighborhood again I'd stop by.

Q_c3xDq7ka8YQ_Jg1128Iw.text: Upon entering, you order at the front, in what they term a fast casual dinning style, are given a number, and take a seat...easy, right? Flower Child is quite airy and pretty inside, and the patio setting outside is attractive as well.  Five of us ordered:  - Chicken with Indian Spiced Cauliflower, Gluten-free Mac & Cheese, and Smashed Organic Potato.  - Chicken with Clementine & Organic Apple and Sauteed Spinach  - Thai Dye Wrap  - Flying Avocado Wrap  - Thai Cashew Quinoa with Salmon  We liked it so much that we came back for: - Forbidden Rice Bowl - Mother Earth Bowl  Flower Child serves healthy, simple, clean food...one might have thought the flavor to be simple as well...CERTAINLY NOT!!! Especially the Quinoa in the Thai Cashew Quinoa Bowl that I shared with my love...it is so good that I almost snuck into the back of the house to try and get the recipe. The salmon was cooked perfect. The Thai Dye was wrapped in a house made, whole wheat, flax & chia seed wrap that was warm and soft. Inside the wrap, the main protein is spicy tofu...spicy enough to notice the spice, but not so much to overpower the taste of all the vegetables inside of the wrap.     There is a self serve drink station with some of the usual suspects as well as a couple of lightly flavored lemonades that our girls enjoyed. Napkins, utensils, togo boxes, and bags are all organized right next to drink station...so if you need a box to go for the left over, just go grab it.    Unlike another health-oriented restaurant located across the street, FC's food has a decently good portion for the price...and it is so flavorful! They use local produce and Gluten light ingredients...but you can have many options as gluten free as well, though sometimes for an extra charge in the case of  the gluten free pita for $1.50. Their protein choices are all natural chicken, sustainable Salmon, grass-fed Steak (they serve medium), and organic non-GMO Tofu.    Flower Child is a popular spot right now for good reasons. Make a point to stop by if you haven't already done so.  -2018 review #8-

9DXDR9281YY_wYI5pp9QTw.text: Lots of healthy/healthier options that taste great, wrapped up in a fun, whimsical space.   Flower Child packs a punch in the flavor department. In spite of the tastiness, the items are generally light and feel-good in nature, so you leave feeling good about what you ate. The portions are a little on the small side, but that tends to be the norm with food in this vein. An adult is typically going to pay $17 - $23 for food, if you're looking to fill up on a normal size meal, though you could spend as little as $9 - $13 if you're eating extra-lite.   Flower Child offers assortments of salads, bowls, wraps, and build-your-own plates. Lots of California, Asian, and Mediterranean influences are found throughout the menu. You could easily come here over and over again and not get tired of the food, based on the numerous options available. The menu is also clearly marked with Vegetarian, Vegan, and Gluten-Free options to make those choices easy to find.  My love and I came in with our girls and one of their friends. We order: - Thai Cashew Quinoa Bowl, with Salmon - Thai Dye Wrap - Flying Avocado Wrap - A Two Item Plate of Sauteed Spinach and Clementine & Organic Apple, with Chicken as an additional Protein add-on - A Three Item Plate of Indian Spiced Cauliflower, Smashed Organic Potato, Gluten-free Mac & Cheese, with Chicken as an additional Protein add-on  On a return visit I tried the Forbidden Rice Bowl, and The Red Chili Glazed Sweet Potatoes, and the Mother Earth Bowl. These were a couple of my favorites, though I also really enjoyed the Thai Cashew Quinoa Bowl, with Salmon.  The ambiance is nice. I was expecting a little more of a hipster feel, but I was pleasantly surprised with equal parts hipster, sunshine, hippie, flowers, and of course, the unavoidable big box modern food corporation overtones. There is a large indoor dining area, as well as a huge patio that includes a large covered, highly-protected portion, surrounded on three sides.   Flower Child is certainly a place I'll be back to.

I believe Danny was his name not sure, he was so sweet though & made sure whatever we needed was met. I ordered the Mother Earth bowl with tofu, super amazing ! qbeFI7jedlelLtfIg_Rdzg.text: I loved my lunch at Flower Child today! The decor is bright, airy and casual. The ordering set up and seating is much like Panera. You order your food at the front counter where you're given a number and an empty cup to fill your beverage.  Next, you pour your drink at the self serve station and grab your utensils before selecting your table.   Pros - Fresh, healthy food at extremely reasonable prices. We had quick and friendly service as well. The menu has a wide variety of options for health conscious folks. In addition, I liked that there were both indoor and outdoor seating options.   Cons - For beverages there's really only tea, lemonade, water and a limited selection of alcohol. Personally, I like a few more beverage options. Another "con" I thought was that you tip your server before you are even "served" due to the fact that you pay first. I like tipping after my meal as I gauge my tip on the service I receive.   Overall, it's a great new spot and I will certainly return. Our food was fresh and tasted great --- not to mention you can't beat the reasonable prices!

BQIDqKfHHHK-KJYLbU0jYw.text: Great for the taste and the ambience is nice and I feel that after speaking with them about their menu, they say it's 90% + organic. It's not bad if you don't mind paying a little more and getting somewhat small portions.  What made this place a 3 for me was that they said "we will try our best to not cross contaminate for your gluten free option" after I told them specifically my girlfriend has celiac disease. This really turned me off and to be honest, it makes me question everywhere I go now. If the menu says Gluten Free, that should mean there are practices in place to maintain that there is no cross contaminates happening so we don't go home and have a flare up, which COMPLETELY SUCKS. This is restaurant 101 honestly, to keep your customers safe. So although they may be an organic restaurant and the food tastes great, I would not go in there hungry and short on cash or with Celiac disease because you're playing with fire. People who are just not that educated on handling something with real consequences for people who cannot have gluten in their diet, SHOULD NOT OWN A BUSINESS. Gluten Free should not be passed off as a "preference". It is a legit health concern and the fact that places like this can only try their best to not cross contaminate means they're not Gluten Free. So how can they put it on their menu and charge more for it?

NG8gs4a7DlrGaRfokEEuxw.text: This place was really good! We went for brunch today. -jEsrdAVvj6YoIdDHfargw.text: We loved the healthy options. The ordering process took us off guard but now that we know it we'll be back. The food was delicious. Fun atmosphere inside and outside seating and I was comfortable not cold.  5 star from me

umBjVDhmxUtWvIxnxz47DQ.text: I was really impressed with my first visit to Flower Child, which is a chain restaurant that recently opened a location in the Boca Park area of Las Vegas. This is their first Flower Child in Nevada. They certainly deserve a warm welcome.  I'm always in search of high quality food that is nutritious and healthy after my workouts. Flower Child did not disappoint.   I was greeted by friendly workers that seemed happy to be there. I was immediately told that if I had any questions about the menu, they'd be glad to help as they admitted that Flower Child has an extensive menu with a lot to choose from. They wanted to make sure I wasn't feeling overwhelmed.   There is something for everyone here whether you prefer to eat vegan, vegetarian, pescatarian, gluten free, or paleo. Everything seemed pretty self explanatory to me, so I ordered one of the more popular dishes on Yelp and was given a number to place on my table while I sat and waited for my food. The seating area is comfortable and the decor was nice; boho/hippie meets farmhouse. My food came out promptly.  I had ordered the Thai Cashew Quinoa Bowl with Chicken added (pictured). The presentation was nice, the produce was fresh and the food tasted as good as it looked. My tastebuds have been thoroughly enlightened! I will be back and am looking forward to trying more things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Cashew Quinoa Bowl with Chicken

8KvRIQHzag0JB3b5IllpMA.text: So I don't write reviews often, but this place is awesome.  Let me start by saying I eat vegetables not because I like them but because one is supposed to.  I came here to try the salad.  I ordered the skinny Cobb and holy crap was it good. I added salmon, but the vegetables were so good I had to force myself to eat it.  Also, I am totally full after eating, but feel great.  Will be back soon!

HUBn1w8N7mP1Kvp3zUsC1g.text: MY HAPPY PLACE! I've fell in love with this place from the moment I saw it. The logo to the the aesthetics was beautifully crafted. It's a self order and self seating restaurant, but they great you with great knowledge about the menu and help you when you are seated.   I've been here a few times since it opened and it's never been a disappointment. I've tried the Organic Kale, Mother Earth & Vegan Poke with Salmon. They all been great and I've tried the Kombucha on tap.  Today we went in on Mother's Day and it was the prime time for lunch, but they took care of my mother and I with the line and table. It was great touch to their service and productivity!  Also, Ashley is a great cashier, she has a great personality and has a lot of recommendations on the menu! Definitely going to try lemon cake next time!

myvnMiQK-DP_PnImgCaSHA.text: I'm in love. Finally, a quick and casual place to have a healthy meal! And a plus, everything I've tried so far has been absolutely delicious. I've come twice in two days, once for dine in and once for pick up,  and may be back tomorrow! So far, I've had the salmon, Indian cauliflower, mac n cheese, brussel sprouts, butternut squash, the corn quinoa side, tofu, and the brussel sprout salad with chicken. The elements and flavors are fantastic! I would reorder every single one again in a heart beat.  The only downside are the small portions for the price. I will gladly pay it for the quality though.  Also, kids meals are 6.50. That's a huge plus for me.

_pkO8gv8-mS3A5USkn5yzg.text: Friendly staff. Clean place. Very spacious. Reasonable prices. Delicious food. Baby friendly! Baby boy loves the food and I don't feel guilty feeding him anything here. It's our new family food spot.  Haven't had anything we didnt like on the menu yet!

l4XJtS-mINOhrHKZn9dIig.text: I had so much fun here! Originally, I was going to meet up with a girlfriend at Honey Salt, but I saw Flower Child and had to go in a try it! I got there earlier than her, so I went inside to look at the menu. They had some lemon infused water up front cause it was really hot that day, so that was nice!  They have a lot of healthy choices - bowls, wraps, salads, etc. I got the Mother Earth Bowl and added the salmon option to it. IT WAS SO YUMMY! I wish the portions were a bit bigger, but the colors of the dish and the overall combination of flavors was refreshing and delicious. I got a drink that you could fill with any of their three lemonades or three teas; I think they change the options everyday. I tried two of the teas and they were both good!   The vibes here are really chill and friendly and it's a cool place to sit and catch up over a quick, yummy bite. Definitely recommend!

9MAa1iEL6YMauCBbY9HplQ.text: So I'm just going to name drop here and say that as we were entering, CARLOS SANTANA was leaving!! How cool is that!! Anyways, this is a cute spot and definitely lives up to its name 'Flower Child' as a hippie chic restaurant. The menu is on a board hanging over the counter. You order, pay and then they bring the food to you. Let's just stay I stood in front of the menu for what seemed like forever, indecisive of what I wanted because everything sounded so good. There was options that catered to everyone: vegetarian, vegan and carnivores. So, it was a good thing there was 4 of us in our party because we each ordered something and we all shared. This place did not disappoint! The Indian spiced cauliflower and the Brussels sprouts were amazing! The spices that they used really brought out a great flavor!! The steak was cooked perfectly medium, and the salmon was cooked perfectly crisp on the outside! Seriously, I'm impressed! Everything tasted delicious!! This is definitely a must try, and who knows maybe you'll see Carlos Santana when you come in.

xwZDZ-OEJKmRAxU126hpHg.text: Que paso Flower Child?  They just changed the menu and got rid of my absolutely favorite dish! (Madras Curry Bowl with chicken). KG1nltA0Msxyqh3eDstwig.text: It's delicious, earthy, and fresh. There's nothing bad I can say about this place because I want more of it in town!   Everything is made to order and they deliver the food to your table. The only thing I probably am not a fan of is the seating arrangement because it's so busy every time I stop by the space is limited. Often, you have to watch out for someone leaving just to dine-in.   But the food... The food is what makes it work. They use quality ingredients and you know you're really paying for good food. While it is a bit of the pricier side of my budget, I will say that I don't mind paying a little extra just because I know my meals are going to be great.   Often, I opt for grilled asparagus, salmon, and spicy eggplant. The whole thing sounds so basic but they have a way of elevating each entree to the next level.   Overall, I would recommend them over and over again!

QoKhxoUhbRCBXVj3s3bqpA.text: I've been here twice- and both times, the food was soooo good. They have quite a few vegan options, my only complaint (and reason why I didn't give 5 stars) The portions were a little small. One time I got the "Glow bowl" and the last time I got the "forbidden rice bowl". They were delicious- just wish there would have been more! I love the ambience of this place- has great vibes and the service is good!

Sdj4SUG8hdPUnShuOZq__w.text: Flower Child reminds me a lot of the healthy restaurants in Pasadena. Located in a very busy plaza by Honey Salt, North Italia, and Pottery Barn, Flower Child offers healthy food options that's made from scratch and can satisfy even the vegetarian, vegan, or paleo eater. And they use fresh ingredients that can be sugar-free, dairy-free, and gluten-free. So if you want to geek out over healthy food options, Flower Child is THE place for you.   So Flower Child actually has several locations around the US. There's a few in California, a lot in Texas, and some in Arizona. I was able to visit the Las Vegas one with a friend for an early dinner one Friday. With healthy comes a higher price tag that you're paying for dishes, but just looking at the interior of the cafe makes you want to dine-in and order away.   There are soups, salads, plates, bowls, and wraps. All options come with no protein - you can add that on for an additional price per the item of your choosing. I really wanted to get something hearty, but I didn't want to pay too much for dinner. I ended up going with the Strawberry Fields salad ($8) and substituting goat cheese for parmesan cheese instead. My friend ordered the Vietnamese Crunch (also $8), which looked just as tasty. (Menu on-line says $8 but I vaguely remember paying $10.)   If you're dining in, you order at the front and take a number to your table. Utensils and water are all self-serve. Food was delivered to our tables quickly. I think the salad is a decent size. It definitely tasted fresh - I could taste the coconut and toasted oats, but I especially liked the chia seed vinaigrette. This dish is also vegetarian and gluten free, so I felt pretty happy about my meal after I finished. My friend's salad was tasty, too. It has more of a zing when eating it - probably due to the spicy lemongrass vinaigrette.   I kind of wish I ordered some protein with the salad or maybe a bowl instead. The dish was definitely pretty and healthy, but I was hungry maybe an hour later. And I ended up devouring my leftovers from lunch. I still highly recommend checking out this place though. They don't have too many restaurants in Vegas that are similar to Flower Child. And the interior was decorated so nicely - super bright colors, flowers at every table, mismatched yet color coordinating chairs. It's all helps add to the ambience of the restaurant.   tl;dr - Pricey healthy food that tastes good. I would recommend going all out if dining here - since everything is so healthy, you don't have to feel guilty about it afterwards!

3rKaDu9rtB4yZS67yzc03w.text: Yes yes yes! Everything about Flower Child is a Yes!! First, the decor is gorgeous! It's beautiful and welcoming and simple. The gal at the counter was so friendly and patient while we decided what to get.  I love the casual "seat yourself" atmosphere. We chose to sit on the patio by they back door of the restaurant.  Our food came out so fast and everything was amazing. My husbands steak was cooked to perfection and my Vegan Ingredient salad was delicious. We also got the Mac & cheese (a must every visit!!) and a few other sides. All the food was perfection.  It was casual and delicious!! Flower child is always a good choice to dine in our book!  Oh! And get the cookies!!

xWHPexcY77pdg5isbyvY8A.text: I stopped by here for a quick afternoon bite and it was perfect! The weather even cooperated so I could enjoy the outdoor patio. I often have a hard time finding a lunch spot with vegetarian options beyond a spongy black bean burger, so this place was an absolute delight. Majority of the menu is vegan/vegetarian and you're given the option to add a protein (chicken, steak, tofu, or salmon). I didn't add a protein, but my meal was still filling. Some reviews gripe about the price, but I feel like the quality and generous portion justifies spending the extra dollar or two.

H2_bRm7hlfflM-OHtuiYVw.text: Yay for HEALTHY! Per their website: "Serving healthy food that takes you to a happy place. That's our promise to you, whether you're vegetarian, vegan, paleo, or just hungry. And just because we can do sugar-free, dairy-free and gluten-free doesn't mean we do flavor-free..."  First timer here, but definitely won't be my last. Met a friend for a light lunch. Place gives me Cali/Colorado vibes... guessing because it reminds me of hippies, nature, and happiness. I really enjoyed the fact that they offer out door seating. With temperatures finally dropping in the LV Valley, this is a perfect spot to eat lunch with your crew/date out doors. It is absolutely adorable that they have a Lemonade stand outside for complimentary refills. I love it!  I had their mushroom beef barley soup, crushed avocado toast and fresh coconuts!!! OMG, the coconut drinks were the best! They are legit from an exotic island, freshly presented to you in the comfort of your desert home, no need to be beach side in a far away place.  The reason for the 4 stars is because the soup was not 5 star quality. Everything else is delicious, healthy, and lovely. I felt happy leaving this place. The vibe makes you feel warm and happy so check it out, you won't be disappointed!

aWNC8MxgZrg2UefJDDDRIw.text: An excellent find.  My vegan friend recommended it for a lunch meeting.  I was pleasantly surprised to find they also served some meats to add to your vegan friendly bowl.  The menu features interesting sides such as red Chile glazed sweet potato which was delicious and the eggplant was also tasty. Not to mention they have gluten free options and serve alcohol.  The seating is not the most comfortable and it is best received as modern cafeteria seating but it has a certain rustic allure.

0Qwcr7pRaEMwo3f6OA4OCQ.text: I don't know how I did not discover this place sooner but better late than never! What a great place to eat not only for their menu but their ambiance is just so calm and relaxing. The menu had a wide range of different type of foods so it was hard to pick just one. I decided to go with The Mediterranean Quinoa salad and I added chicken for protein. It was absolutely delicious, filling and did not make me feel yucky after. I cannot wait until the next time I can come back and try other items on their menu. Definitely a must try place if you are looking for some delicious healthy dishes!

73lq_L9mMa5yI_36ghLsgQ.text: I've been wanting to dine at Flower Child for some time now, so finally I made plans with my bestie for lunch on Sunday! Clearly I couldn't wait because I totally felt the need to post mates some lunch today! SO HAPPYYYY that I did!   I ordered the crushed avocado toast and the rebel wrap! Everything was delicious! The wrap so super fresh and the flavors were great, I will say if you don't like onions maybe ask for it without, clearly I don't mind them! The only negatives about take out with delivery is that I do wish the food was warmer! Next time I would only dine when ordering the toast, it's kinda of hard to keep a runny egg warm for long!  I'm excited to stop in and explore other options on the menu! I love the fact that they cater to everyone, not only meat eaters, but vegans as well!

MzsJ6PXuXThxgKKCyG-o1w.text: A little pricey for a plate + wine (around $25) but this is a unique place for Las Vegas. The food is fresh and is a great healthy option. Some of my favorites are he skinny Cobb, Mother Earth bowl and the goat cheese toast!

KAg4MVrp068hcTzlK6Gb4A.text: Alright I'm officially a believer of all the hype. I finally got to try Flower Child with a friend during the week for dinner. I'm a pescatarian and she's vegetarian so this place was like heaven for us with the options. The whole restaurant inside and out and very well decorated. They have a dog friendly patio and other cute touches like yoga mat parking.   For food I had the Mother Earth bowl with tofu added. It tasted AMAZING. The ingredients were all very fresh and all of the flavors blended well together. My only complaint would be the price, it was pretty expensive for what it was. I get it that all the ingredients are top notch, but I'd definitely come more often if it was more affordable.  You still have my heart Flower Child and I can't wait to try something new. I'd love to see more kombucha flavor options.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mother Earth with Tofu

AjPM2NhJaEd5uWbrXMKuww.text: Clean eating period.  Reasonable price, location is convenient, staffs are professional..  I mean... I'm already planning on eating there everyday.  Lol.

Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V0hVEP_j7NIfTBkdnZe0QQ.text: I came here because I was craving healthy and this kind of food. I ordered the skinny cob with tofu and the forbidden rice with shaved beef. I also ordered a lemonade. I wasn't too crazy about their lemonade but their food was amazing. Everything was delicious. I loved the forbidden rice and and can see myself eating this frequently. The skinny salad was delicious and well seasoned with sauce. I loved the variety in it but I would definitely try salmon or other protein next time because the tofu was alright with the salad. I came during lunch and it was busy, looked like there wasn't enough seats. Luckily I got my order to go. I recommend calling in your order ahead and online.

aItdSymm0Hol--3AwRopwg.text: I'm going to give Flower Child 2 stars solely on service. The first time I have ever tried flower child I ordered the forbidden rice, and the cashier told me they were sold out and so I ordered something else. As I sat down and my friend joined me after she ordered and I asked her what did she get and she ordered the forbidden rice and it wasn't sold out! That was really annoying.  Today, my friend ordered the pho and realized he wanted to change it to Mother Earth and the cashier says it's too late but he can order it to go... what? I've never been anywhere where the customer wasn't accommodated. I work in the service industry and customer service isn't handled that way. He basically told us too bad eat what you ordered originally just because he rang it in. All he had to do was void the order, or the product was the same price, I'm sure he could've told the chef since he was too lazy to void the original order and start over.   Next time I think I'd rather go to vegenation instead.

ZqpD0soScwROH1r2zDUv4g.text: My office orders lunch here about twice a week and the food is always amazing! I just wish that I could say the same about some of their staff. One girl in particular that usually takes to-go orders is extremely rude everytime I come in and I could never imagine talking to a customer the way she does (for literally no reason). I know her name, but I won't put her on blast. I've called the store to speak to a manager about her attitude, but I just get told to leave a message because it's during their busy hours. My hopes is that the manager will see this and that maybeee they are aware of the issues and will discuss manners and appropiate customer service to their staff :)  Keep up the good work though, the food is incredible

2OCZvy5DhziSm9hsfQsSpg.text: Great food, great atmosphere and VERY friendly people! The food was delicious. I'm currently on a very bland diet so when I called I had quite a picky order. They didn't hesitate and made me feel welcomed. The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is the price. It was pretty expensive for a little chicken and a little brown rice.

9dpg69h-JB4D3WxOhZNqqA.text: The Best We Eat Heat once a week. Fresh and good.  Menu is always changing. Give it a try.

wWMzLhDb9zaiA4j_RmsOBQ.text: I stop here for take away a few times a month. Love the ease of their menu & offerings. Every time I order I include the skinny Cobb salad (I adore the dressing). About half of the time my order is made correctly, the other half of the time it's missing ingredients. I'm baffled how they can manage to mess up an item with such few ingredients, but it's a let down every time they do. I'm finally writing a review because on top of them leaving out ingredients in my salad today, it was full of browned romaine. My advice would be to double check any to-go orders to avoid a let down.

PXuCRHMKcwwkv8wbY-tqww.text: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY, THEIR DELIVERY SERVICE IS HORRIBLE! Food is excellent, in-house service and amenities are excellent, too. Their delivery service, however, is abysmal. We are a busy office just 5 minutes away, yet on multiple occasions we have been delivered someone else's order, and once, the food was never delivered! Management keeps apologizing, but their corporate office needs to step in and change delivery vendors -- every time there's a delivery mistake, we lose time, get billed for food not delivered/wrong order, have to go through management all over again, etc. Not worth it. As much as I like their food, we won't be ordering delivery until their management gets it right, which is a shame because we place orders for hundreds of dollars worth of lunches every week.
