TMw3XUHEqjMueAYZyr3MRQ.text: The Mother Earth bowl with salmon is delicious! A great healthy organic place to eat in the suburbs of Vegas. The decor is cozy and the staff is on point.

M9iC7TN9dbuA58Z9a6Qk6g.text: It's unfortunate this location is a distance away from home and work! I had their vegan ingredient salad with sustainable salmon and it was absolutely delicious! Definitely want to go back!

-OMGPBS-i34rUmkWcgb2hA.text: I didn't come to Flower child intentionally, but I'm glad I stopped in for a late lunch this week. The restaurant wasn't too busy at 2:30pm on a Wednesday after Christmas. The dining area was a bit chilly, but the sun shining in through the large windows made it livable. I ordered a plate with Brussels sprouts, mashed potatoes and spicy eggplant for $9. My mom got the avocado toast, which comes with some kind of white shredded cheese, a medium boiled egg, and sesame seeds on a slice of warm and toasty grainy bread. The best item on my plate was the eggplant, which was spiced in a Thai style with some pepper slices and a sweet and hot glaze. The Brussel sprouts were filled with lemon yuzu flavor and well caramelized, but I found them to be a bit salty. Otherwise everything else was seasoned perfectly. Free cucumber lemon water at the front was the perfect accompaniment to our fresh and reasonably light lunch. Will definitely be back when I'm in town again.

Xeu-raSUv5hrsKgexngnqQ.text: Go to spot for a nice healthy salad with great ambiance!  Love the Kale salad with Salmon and every now and then will pair it with a beer or glass of wine

YBivFKa2uR-4darvqfBoZg.text: I really had high hopes for this place. The first time was great.... Today I went in and ordered a plate with tofu and Mac and cheese. When it came out there were 4 tiny pieces of tofu on my plate. Much smaller than what I received the first time and much smaller than the other reviewers' pictures show. Pretty pitiful...

at7vgZdiigO8xhdx94B_Jg.text: Great menu, decor, ambiance.  If you're looking for something healthy, this is probably one of those preferable restaurant/cafe you'd want to go to.   There are many options for adding proteins into your salad or bowl. They also carry local brewed beer if you're looking for something refreshing. The only thing I felt was average was their fountain drink options. However, that was my personal taste. I'm sure other guest enjoys their drink selection.

zwUpiqSms82bNNuQPDd8eQ.text: I finally tried this place and already can't wait to go back!  I would literally love to eat every item on this menu, it's just amazing.  The price is reasonable and the portions are good.  Awesome place to eat anytime!

j-DktFhaBMQ0n46S46WjHA.text: This vegetarian oriented  restaurant is awesome. For lunch we had the cauliflower coconut curry soup was so flavorful I went into deep depression when I saw the bottom of the bowl...next was the main course I chose salmon as my protein..a right sized piece of grilled fish  and grilled asparagus and the cauliflower side...each dish created by culinary genius w subtle and complex flavoring and textures..my taste buds where in heaven having never traveled to such new and exciting places before

0N74CSuFz1j3xXUAyl8M6A.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. The portions are small but delicious. The problem is the prices. I had soup ( tomato squash which was outstanding) and avocado toast. It was $14 with a tip. That's too pricey for a simple lunch. But, food wise it was a 5 star

erkByE1s2KvGuIQADK1sAw.text: Very fresh and healthy food.  I like the bowls better than the wraps.  Quick service and clean restaurant.

sNtVSV5RqdIifZsfe8IPQQ.text: Every time we come here it's totally crowded but always delicious!!! Love this place so much!!!

W6KT4PWJO1HjkY72xtBSxg.text: Absolutely love everything about this place every time I've gone there the food was amazing quick clean delicious my favorite place.  Definitely try the kale and salmon salad the best

elsLME-okofKK-kUHTEThA.text: The food is good, but take out service is not. This is the third and last time that I will use it. It is always backed up unless you have access to a computer to plan ahead. If you walk in and place an order, bring a book! I waited a half hour for a rebel and hummus. The place was just opened and wasn't busy. The cashier was very apologetic and went several times to check on it. I saw her approach a supervisor who apparently didn't think I was important enough to address in person. If you eat in, you get your food fast! What is the difference if it goes in a container or a plate?  The portion of hummus was smaller on my take out. Between the slooow service and high price, it's just not worth it. I think I'll just cook at home. The whole idea of take out is that you're in a hurry to be somewhere else!

GINoZvuTPtCKP2m-8S5uiw.text: Okay, so I really, really regret updating my review and giving one star but... There is a particular employee who works in the kitchen area who is ridiculously obnoxious! She's a short Hispanic looking woman and she drives me NUTS. You wouldn't think the back of house employees would even be seen much or heard by us trying to eat, but my GOD, she is extremely unprofessional. She was speaking and cursing so loudly about other employees, I assume, on more than one occasion. I recently heard her vulgar screams from the cooking area again that my son and I just had to pack up and leave. We did return a couple days after this incident, and she was passing through the entrance cursing loudly and was still talking smack about who knows what!  She needs some therapy, beer, d*&^, a Valium, SOMETHING. I do not know what's going on in this lady's life but I don't want to return because she makes me dread going there. Flower Child now seems like it's got an incredibly low, unprofessional environment because of this woman. The girls up front and the servers have been great, and the meat and sweets specifically are so amazingly tasty, but I'd rather just learn the recipes myself than hear that unhappy lady again! I really wanted to be a regular here, but I would never allow any of my employees act this way in my place of business. You think you're Gordon Ramsey honey, but you're not!

WEXEQZjXr11_U3UqOVBmIQ.text: Might be my favorite go to restaurant in Las Vegas. So many awesome vegetarian options. Love the egg plant love the salads and awesome lemonade.

VIU1I84ybBJwWwE0iiDJjA.text: Great menu selection for those who like vegan or gluten free options. Everything was very fresh. The service is wonderful, staff is nice and considerate. I love the ambiance here, it's not too dark or too bright. Very casual, fun, and light feeling. I ordered the Mother Earth with Tofu, and it was delicious.

W6JIIWk8SU_HHE9wqBXXKw.text: I eat here at least once a week and the food is always consistently good no matter what I get! Go go go it's delicious and the atmosphere and staff are awesome!

mAzHHyz-9S-m2b7bKkzmsQ.text: Outstanding lunch -- loved the Cashew Thai Quinoa Bowl and Vegetarian Poke got high marks from another in our group. Service was excellent and the price of lunch very affordable. Great location, easy parking. We will absolutely be back

rzlFh_hmOGJqCJTHIN_aXg.text: Got food from here about 4 days ago and again yesterday chose the plate you pick your protein and then up to three sides their veggies sides are so good not just boiled or steamed so many choices all done different ways so tasty very affordable for fresh food and fast and friendly love this place

s8Cv3FmxP0htzExs72sHVA.text: We were so happy to find this place since it is close to where my daughter just moved to. The first trip we got the avocado hummus, skinny cobb salad, and the flying avocado wrap. All were so delicious. We had to go back later in the week and forced ourselves to order something different. This time we got the free spirit wrap (our favorite) and chopped vegetable salad. You can't go wrong with whatever you pick. I can't wait to come back on my next visit.

ufuDp15x5-d_rm563cpmvA.text: Nothing bad to say about Flower Child.  Food is healthy, delicious, reasonably priced and while it's always crowded, we've never had to wait to find a spot to sign. The steak is delicious and the Japanese eggplant is out of this world.  And I've never had better quinoa anywhere else. My favorite part is how reasonably priced the kids meals are and it's basically a smaller portion of the regular entrees and sides, as opposed to the usual boxed mac n cheese, chicken nuggets, burger or hotdogs you find on most kids menus at most places.

3Sg_nIPOjfLRD3fIspSCcQ.text: Great atmosphere and food. Perfect for us Vegans and our meat loving friends.  Prices are reasonable and food is delicious, but watch out they pickle some of the food in their dishes.  Ask before you order.

6y6gzzuhzQa4RQDIJjKedg.text: This place is amazing.  First off, the food is stellar!  Every single item is delicious.  Secondly, amazing customer service!  Kane is a tremendous ambassador for this location, and knows a thing or two about how to keep his customers coming back!  Thanks, Kane!

U7UYUcQtCW_x0BzSGXUymg.text: The food is great, many vegan and vegetarian options. The atmosphere is vibrant, young and helthy and the only downside I have is that by now after 3 visits I tried everthing on the menu, hopefully they will come-up with new dishes.

qHwMeo8bF9p8DfmEZcKrwQ.text: Great place!!! Food is awesome! Had the sauteed spinach, mash potato, and cauliflower with chicken. Salads are yummy too.

7Ewl9WqIMdOYFt1rKH1ZOw.text: If you are looking for a restaurant with healthy, fresh, DELICIOUS options this is the place! One of my absolute favorites! So creative and so yummy without the commercialized, cafeteria, sterile feel that you often find in healthier restaurants.

FGcJIB5b-33AhYub6Uiw0Q.text: Food was great! I had the Mother Earth with chicken and a very nice girl who helped me decide what to have. My food was brought out to me in less than 10 minutes. I will definitely be back!

H9Dp-6AAMi_B8Rbi6Y0Ztg.text: Your food is great. Your service sucks. 8 people waiting in line and you have one person ringing. Manager comes out to fix order and then leaves. No help let customers wait even longer. Severs laid back attention is annoying. I get the name is flower child..

V6fXX1izv_be9RLWjStFgA.text: The food omg is so good. Love this place. Love the atmosphere. Employees are nice and attentive.

Came back the next day it was so good. Put this one in your regulars.

1-qKMb2cyOsVlyKMvq5Jog.text: Awesome experience...food, service and ambience all top notch. Food choices high quality, tasty and HEALTHY! Easy parking, friendly service and we spotted a celebrity.

Uv0c6jnRf8E53WoafMByIg.text: Amazing food, many fresh vegetables, grass-fed beef if you eat meat cooked very well. My new healthy spot for after gym or quick healthy meal. Delicious!!! Nice vibe and super clean.

bHu2lsxfRB0nhE_MB5Anew.text: We love this place! Friendly to all lifestyles of eating. We really loved the seasonal items such as the mushroom pho! The vegan Mac and cheese is a great staple. Also, their tofu is a great texture, it's actually is baked after it's been marinating for a bit. Delicious! Random fact: love their bathrooms as well, always so clean and well lit.

T6qotDtkL8VtSVHn9nGBUQ.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. Everyone I go, the waitresses and waiters are always so nice. A lady with long black hair working the to-go was very nice and awesome! T7ASieP8cP0vlMwMCnqweg.text: Came on the first day and my wife and I were so impressed. Nice employees, healthy & delicious, and at a good price! Will be frequent flyers for sure.

An5K_Rpn-IHyoSrWAozkRA.text: Flower Child is my favorite spot for lunch. The salads are made with the freshest ingredients and the dressings are low-fat and amazing. _qx2oDmUmngYHhRDmC7VSg.text: The food here is amazing I highly recommend, i had the Flying Avacado wrap with some Rose Peddle Lemonade, it was delicious, the staff is very friendly, the environment and vibe is on point. c_SLR4gGUJzl3ssf1D9A4g.text: I am officially addicted to this place!!!!  I haven't had ANYTHING I haven't liked.  Well worth the drive as I live about 20 miles away; and I keep coming back.  I hope a location in the FAR Northwest is in their future!!!

-VL9Vlm09st68m_7ey2rLA.text: A nice place to hand out. Nice atmosphere and food is ok. The prices are decent and service was good. I might come back.. chicken was to salty tho.....

QRiTs9oV3lNTKP7tyFcv7w.text: The food here is simple and delicious. Very clean ingredients that make you feel whole and clean after consumption. The only downside is that the food is extremely expensive and seemingly overpriced. But healthy food often comes with a premium nowadays.

7Q4BjIwcOYvC9qROwizfCA.text: Beautiful restaurant, thoughtfully designed.  Loved the bandanas they all wear.  It's all part of the hippie theme of this place.  Weird they kind of put themselves out there as vegan/vegetarian, yet serve meat.  I like the food here.  Been in a few times.  Lively lunch crowd.  Good energy and service, but the food just doesn't do it for me.  It's not bad, just nothing I crave.   Just a simple, overpriced lunch in a chain restaurant that tries very hard to be cool.  Cool enough for the summerlin ladies who lunch crowd, but not for this here og real life hipster hippie chick.     Bottom line is nothing here is any better than stuff u can make at home.  Meh.

dOJrB6Yecs6i4L52TvFPNw.text: Flower Child has been my favorite restaurant, but this experience in Summerlein was subpar for me and my husband. Compared to their other locations, this wasn't good. The portions were half of what they were in LA, Phoenix and Del Mar. The green beans and eggplant were almost raw.  They mostly served the bottoms of the asparagus.   We told them about all of these and they were very sweet.  They replaced the vegetables, but the beans were still raw. Kinda disappointed.  The servers and bus boys were really great though.

szTdDLJ-iMfD1ff7XXNE8A.text: The menu at Flower Child is unique and gives you options galore. Something for everyone, even if you're not into healthy green food. We've now been there twice, and I look forward to going back every time. Everything is fresh, well-prepared, seasoned perfectly and the portions are very generous. My favorite is the curry option, had chicken to it and it's really on point. Very healthy and well prepared.  The salads are also excellent, very fresh and a lot of different options. If you want something quick and healthy, this is a good option. If you have a sweet tooth, their baked goods are really really good. Great vibe in the restaurant, and also very easy to take out. Well worth visiting this excellent place.  Tip: go for the different lemonade options. Very refreshing and perfectly made.

GX4Kq_clMc1cJfPUbFOvVQ.text: It was okay, not great. I got the beef with eggplant and the portion was extremely small.  You order from the counter and grab a number and they bring you the food.  Food was okay, but I have had better eggplant and beef at other place.  This beef was dry and chewy, maybe they were having a bad day.

M9mX99P7jXVNjukWwIT14Q.text: A great spot for vegans and healthy eaters generally.  It's super cute to boot (the AC is a chilly though).  BF wants to come here about once a day.   cashew quinoa bowl - 4.5  Mother Earth bowl - 4.5 (the sweet potatoes in this are killer - and are different than the sweet potato side FYI.  Also add tofu - the tofu is really good for a non-Asian restaurant)  skinny Cobb - 4.5 (with vegan avi-cilantro dressing)  olive oil cupcake/muffin - 5!  It's so soft and divine. Whatever that glazing is, it's perfect.  Not vegan, but gluten free.  Please make a vegan version guys!!! Mac and Cheese - 1. And I love Mac and cheese.   This is our favorite Fox Concepts restaurant, hands down. The rest of them are good but still taste a little sterile, like a chain. Flower Child hits it out of the park.

GxbiBDcI1eArPJ37X40vNA.text: Well just finished my lunch and i can tell you my stomacg is sooo happy!!!! Ordered the rice with spicy eggplant and salmon it was sooo delicious that by the end my plate was almost clean. I also had their vegan soup one of the best i ever had. I will be back for sure. Lots of parking and they have outdoor seating

bQN7lDRchAVH1jp7MpKqfg.text: Only have been once and need to go again! High quality ingredients that they definitely highlight and do not ruin! It's healthy, you'll feel good about your choices after eating here! The inside is so adorable, it's perfect for your next Instagram post.

83eUy6eYGln8hUoS3WTW9A.text: DO NOT GO HERE! I went here yesterday and ordered the Thai Cashew Bowl and threw it all up. I'm guessing their food is neither fresh or clean. My mother included got a horrible stomach ache. You're literally better off making your own food or going to Whole Foods. I knew I never should have returned because the previous time I went I also had a horrible stomach

6MrMsfwfpaANjwBfbrd79Q.text: Delicious! Had the Mother Earth bowl, very colorful with lots of veggies, and quinoa!! Very accommodating for allergies too. My kids loved the kids meal, so reasonable in price for lunch too. They loved the steak and chicken, fruit was amazing and broccoli

EDXCBOhOElwDfJEzIi80pw.text: Good food. Nice price. Unbeatable surroundings!   I've been here a couple times now, and continue to be impressed with the flavor and portion size of their bowls. The price is not as bad as you might expect considering the amount of detail that goes into the elegant atmosphere, the cheerful and friendly staff, and the exquisite, flavorful food.  Flowerchild is a MUST whenever my girlfriend and I are in town.  This is what proud business ownership looks like!

THlFKZ40ALAW903Xrr8hPw.text: Yummy, healthy, friendly service, and a great aesthetic. I can't ask for too much more from a great dining spot. On my first visit, I dropped by for some take-out lunch, and I was incredibly impressed. This restaurant is a chain running throughout the Southwest, and I absolutely love that Las Vegas is getting more dining spots with great design.   Since I didn't have much time, I grabbed a quick bite to-go. The Mother Earth bowl (not pictured unfortunately) was an incredibly filling and affordable dish. A base of rice was complimented by avocado, sweet potato, portobello mushrooms, greens, and a lot more. I felt like I had my fill of healthy food for the week, and I actually loved it.   The menu is simple, with lots of healthy and seemingly tasty options. Next time I come, I think I will have to do a yoga class before-hand. I would love to know how it feels to be a full-circle healthy gal!

AzL3fzCfeHPQIYBUpQgQ8w.text: Forbidden Rice Bowl with Shaved Beef.   Really nice flavor with a hint of spicy ginger flavor.   Great casual laid back atmosphere.  Even though it is fast casual, I found there to be a super friendly unpretentious level of service.

7tlYl0kPNxsCDp063sT4ww.text: First vegetarian restaurant I've been to in Vegas and wow, can I say it is so darn cute. The aesthetics of this restaurant is everything (I feel like I'm in dining in a garden) It's my aunts favorite restaurant and so she took the entire fam to try it last night. We tried lots of dishes (even the kid ones, which is a great deal) and my favorite was Spicy Japanese Eggplant. Not a big eggplant person but this dish changed my mind. We went for dinner and I wasn't full after, so I'll probably be back again for brunch or lunch!

h9M3g0SGJhaRDn_iGjVh7w.text: As a non vegan/cheese lover I give 3 stars. If I was "healthier" or vegan I'd probably give it more stars. But basically seems like a "healthier" / vegan option Panera. You order and the counter and they bring you your food. You get your own drinks, condiments and silverware. So food is pricier but less tasty and hopefully better for you... if I have the get my own silverware eh, that's just not gonna make me too excited.  So I think of it as fast food. oh and they have beer, so there's a star right there. Also super cute place. Ideal for a lunch meetings. But no booths so Panera is more comfortable from my standpoint.

J3dLWPhF5oKog5TuEDLF8w.text: The last few times I ate here the food was not great and for the prices it should be amazing. I ordered 2 sides and steak and the steak had no flavor and over cooked, the sides were just okay. Not sure what everyone sees in the place. Maybe I'm ordering the wrong things? Lemonade is good!

LODdf91fvh47HMW1esYWAw.text: Favorite place for my girlfriends and I to meet up!   Had a holiday lunch there on Friday with 6 of us----no reserved seating however busboy super nice scouting out a table for us.   You order at counter and they bring it over.   It's pretty and bright inside---definitely the ladies who lunch in Summerlin with fun people watching.    Recommend:  rebel wrap, avo toast, soups,     I normally order the pick 3:  you get to pick 3 items for $12.  The grilled eggplant is delish  I think everyone will like it as it caters to every taste---carnivore to vegan to allergies!  Happy vibe.

GTz0tvKfdAyAI5gZGV7ozw.text: STROKE SOUP/Chicken Soup with Brown Rice is DANGEROUSLY MUCH TOO SALTY! Wow...Someone's screw is loose to believe they can serve this to the public! I knew Flower Child would look at me cross-eyed if I attempted to return it, so I fought through to finish it. So sorry I ordered 2. Immediately after consuming it "I did NOT feel good." Racing heart, slight headache (which I never get). So as soon as I arrived home I took my blood pressure and sure enough it was SCARY! 160/105, heart rate 94! What I feared was TRUE. I drank plenty of water to attempt to wash out the salt. I THREW THE OTHER SOUP IN THE TRASH! Just 2 days prior my blood pressure was good at 135/90, heart rate 78. Examine my Flower Child receipt and you will see that in approximately 2 hours that shit soup almost sent me to the Emergency Room! Is Flower Child's too salty soup against the Board of Health?  Other than the STROKE SOUP, Flower Child does have some delicious dishes that are not dangerously salty.  One other area they can improve on is the Women's Restroom, because the non-handicapped stall is so small you are SURE to rub your leg on the toilet or have your purse accidentally fall in the toilet, as there absolutely NO more than 1/2" clearance between the door and the toilet...terrible. Peace

7TtAvoi-Z0gZdmpFO88G1w.text: World Peace  After one unsuccessful attempt at lunch due to an obsessive amount of equally hungry flower children lined up as far back as the parking lot I opted for take out over the weekend. I'm no health guru by far just a fluffy girl that enjoys soul satisfying Pescatarian food and this hipster cafeteria style restaurant hit the spot.   Pick Two $7: Red chili glazed sweet potato with bok choy & sesame seed is pretty damn good but the sweet corn & quinoa with greek yogurt is flipping amazing!!! $7 Salmon protein add; was meh I could have done without it to be honest. $8.25  Organic Kale Salad with pink grapefruit, organic apple, black currant, smoked almond, white cheddar, apple cider vinaigrette was pretty impressive. $27 including a drink I'm certain I'll be back soon to fuel my mind body and soul.

e23m5Pzx92460Tu4Ca5FrQ.text: If you are vegetarian, vegan, or not a big meat eater - you will probably love this place. There are a ton of options- salads, wraps, even ramen (which was not bad) AND if you don't add a meat protein (an additional $5-$8), you can have a very reasonably priced lunch. They also have some pretty great lemonades and unsweetened green tea that I would recommend to get. Service is also great.   Now the reason for the 4 instead of 5 star. I get it - eating quality ingredients is expensive. Health is wealth. All of that. But when I am spending over $20 on lunch for an entree and a drink - in comparison to other lunch spots, I do find it to be on the pricier range.   The food is good. I enjoyed my rebel wrap and was full but it wasn't like $15 for a wrap good. There was a ton of steak in there, the dressing and arugula were good but the portion for the price is whatever. The ramen is also good. Great for non meat eaters. I did add chicken to mine, which was tender (reminded me of sous vide chicken) but my noodles were undercooked and clumped up at the bottom of the bowl. The broth was fine and I would probably think about eating it again but I also spent like $16 on it.   The food is great for the gram. The restaurant is very aesthetically pleasing. It's super clean. The service is great but the food was just not my thing.

grTLbPDprx7G47L04dlRxQ.text: RATING: A SERVICE: A- AMBIANCE: A  OVERVIEW: A The first thing you notice when walking into this establishment is the very open and welcoming space. Amazing decoration, great for a business meeting, first date, or just a casual dining experience. This place literally transported me to SoCal! They have a ton of Vegetarian/Vegan options. I ordered the Thai Dye Wrap and a Cold Brew coffee. The wrap comes with tofu, so I was a little hesitant to try. After taking the first bite, I was completely blown away. The wrap got better and better after every bite. Definitely will be back!  *A= Outstanding - D= Needs Improvement

CQQzPRXA18iPi7ChKdnFEw.text: Loved this little fresh veggie spot.  Salads were great.   It was sort of like a Panera but better, more local  feel, more  organic and fun selections,  its an order at counter place,  and then they bring it out. Very casual.

W-UUN-u27ne1XoUQFLECOA.text: Great food, good price, terrific ambience. Staff always warm and friendly and attentive. Ashley does a great job and is always so pleasant! Get the eggplant, it's delicious!

nYg0hhcsnwkbJSzXFnzPZA.text: This place is a hidden gem!! I came here with my cousin looking for a small, healthy lunch and I was super grateful that she recommended this spot.  For starters, I feel that this place is very affordable for what they serve. If I'm not mistaken, a lot of their foods are vegan/vegetarian and that usually signals that the prices are going to be on the higher side. But not here! I ordered the Healthy Kids (they didn't mind me ordering from it even though I'm older than 12 lol). I chose the chicken protein with broccoli with parmesan and the gluten-free mac n cheese. For being a kid-sized portion and the price, I was very content with my meal. They were very generous with the portions and the food tasted great (especially the mac n cheese!!) My cousin ordered two plates: the sauteed spinach and sweet potato with tofu and she was very happy with her order too.  The inside is very spacious and a great place to hang out with your friends. There's a lot of seating so I don't imagine that you'd ever have to wait. I loved the decor and earthy theme that they had.  I can't wait to come back here and try their other dishes! I recommend this place to anyone who wants a healthy, yummy meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F1WR1Lt-uDVuO3k7OJdubA.text: Hands down, best place. Fresh food, clean ingredients, fair pricing. I am a huge health and nutrition person and have trouble eating out due to hassle of locating real, clean, fresh, and healthy food. This place was perfect!

o__FZnbudk4z3_2FW55tbA.text: Flower Child (Summerlin / Las Vegas, NV)  If you're trying to eat healthy, then Flower Child is for you.    If you're trying to lose a few pounds, then Flower Child is definitely for you since the portions are small.    I don't know what it is about this place, but I always leave feeling better about myself and extremely hungry.  There's no doubt about it.  Flower Child specializes in "clean" healthy dishes.  They also do a great job serving delicious food.  The menu is kept simple. They have a few apps, salads, bowls, plates, and wraps.  Everything that I have tried has been good and worth it if you don't mind the small portions and expensive price tag.  Bird is the Word is my go-to meal here.  It's a wrap made with grilled chicken, broccoli, and cheese.  This wrap is big enough to be snack, but too small to be considered a meal.  But like I stated earlier, the portions are small and extra protein for an additional cost is highly recommended.  Overall, I'm a fan.  I just know better to have a few extra calories before dining here.    2019 Yelp Review #24 .

u2rKUgNrdXhgbA1ocadVPQ.text: In a nutshell: Fantastic food, wonderful, chill ambiance.  This place is beautiful inside and out. Inside was buzzing with happy people. The kitchen is open and guests are able to see food being prepared. There is seating outside, and food gets brought out to you. Ordering is done at the counter from a huge diverse menu. One thing that stood out to me was EVERYONE was smiling. Guests, staff, everyone. The energy of the place was electric yet also calming if that makes sense. The menu has a ton of options, and is suitable for vegetarians, vegans, GF people, and meat eaters as well. I had the steak wrap and the flavor was something unexpected, earthy, clean, and delicious. Perfectly put together, not too much of any one thing.  I will definitely return and will definitely recommend to friends .

QdKfLvO82rsY2bootBNe8A.text: I love Flower Child. If I could afford to eat there everyday I would. However, that is definitely one of the cons, you can spend a good $20 with a wrap, a cookie and a drink easily on just yourself. However, the food is good. Sometimes the turkey wrap that I get is dried out but I end up always ordering it again because the avocado hummus is too delicious! My main attraction for coming here is that I LOVE their chocolate chip cookie. They use coconut flour, etc. so if you have allergies make sure you check the ingredients first! The line can be a bit of a wait to order, but you can also order online if you are on the go. Seating is never a problem since they have plenty of patio and indoor space. The bathroom is cute and the vibe of the place is my type of place to hang out at. They have a bunch of different drinks that you can order too plus alcohol.

nNtZo0o0lgaIzHERzC-UmA.text: First time coming here and i must say in very disappointed. Customer service is everything! I came with a friend that comes here often , we came in and ordered our food. 50$ ok not bad, plus a 10$ tip for a self serve restaurant, No biggie. So we sit down and grab drinks .. our appetizers came and i asked "Hailey" for it utensils and she pointed to the back and said "they are back there" and walked away rudely. No big deal i got up and got us both silverware. She was Extremely rude , no smile when delivering food . Her hair was swinging everywhere and not tied up. When i ordered my food i asked for butter and lemon , Hailey then again pointed to the lemon in the back of the room as her next stop was a table near the ice machine . Just ridiculous! I will not be back !

DBAHnlhAVzayIYxuWLfm6g.text: I guess as far as vegetarian restaurants go, this place is great, however if you are just trying to eat something different, it's kinda just overpriced very average food. The prices to add protein is pretty high, 6 dollars to add 5 very thin slices of overcooked steak or 7 to add a tiny piece of salmon to an entree seems steep.   This place also serves the latest trendy food item... avocado toast! Nothing like 8 bucks for a slice of bread with half an avocado on it! However, I gotta say flower child has the best tasting and generally the best avocado toast I've ever had. They put a soft boiled egg on top and man oh man ... It's a game changer!

frA0jxFObAO-PevnWniH5Q.text: I said "wow" after every bite of my meal at this place. Ordered the Mother Earth bowl + chicken and not only was it a big portion, but you could tell everything was super fresh and the way all ingredients worked together was something special. I also ordered the avocado hummus and safe to say that's THE BEST hummus I've ever had in my life! Loved the thin pitas they served with it too. I will 10000% be coming back here, several times, before I leave Vegas this summer.

6MAzjYNHVhjm58CYTZ60mg.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! The feels you get from it, the atmosphere, the energy, the fresh juice, and most of all the food! The food tastes fresh. I've enjoyed several of the salads, soup and my most favorite is the plate option. I usually get the salmon, sweet potatoes, and mac n cheese. I could literally eat this particular meal at least once or twice per week. The juice is made fresh daily. They have a carrot and ginger juice that is refreshing and should be bottled and sold. If I knew what days they had this juice I would drive there just to get it every time.  The pricing is decent. Less than restaurant pricing and more than fast food.

RgTTlElMes138z8gKM7F_g.text: First time at this place visiting from NorCal.   I got the vegan ramen mainly because it's cold outside. It was okay for a healthy resturant where ramen isnt the main item. In other words ramen isnt there specialty. The broth was good and vegan. The noodles were thick and kinda chewy. The pickled cucumbers were not a good addition to this dish and recommend that they dont pickle it or that they replace It with a different veggie.   There are definitely a few more items on the menu that look appealing and this place seems to be a local favorite in this area.   The staff were very nice and attentive.   Overall I would definitely back to try other dishes.

4qtcqUhTCtmWUrUpdkxmDA.text: Where is the flavor?  This place is unseasoned, and the food is overcooked. I was seriously disappointed after wanting to come eat here for MONTHS! Also for such a small portion it is WAY overpriced. The ambience is cute, and the food IS healthy but there is no flavor and everything was dry. Skip this place and find somewhere else.

jgCSnYQS7wbKtKxz6d4u5A.text: First time trying this place, and I have wished to for a while. We put in a pick up order. The asparagus and quinoa was amazing tho and the Mother Earth bowl too. The portions were really small on the to go food compared to the high prices. N11o3MD78rPCzsyoQMvQOA.text: Cute place with tasty food!  My husband ordered the Skinny Cob salad with grass fed steak- very good!  Steak tender and juicy and delightful greens.  I ordered the strawberry fields and made a few changes.  Not a fan of arugula or goat cheese, so I substituted mixed greens and feta.  I also added almonds and pistachios.  The chia dressing was very good!  Overall I love the food and service.  The biggest negative for me (and the reason I didn't give five stars) is how LOUD it is there.  I eaten both inside and out on the covered patio, and the music is so loud it was hard to have a conversation with friends.  I'd recommend this place for fresh healthy food and hope they adjust the volume of there music soon so I can enjoy my company as well.

Service: Walk up and order your food, they give you a number and they drop off your food! Not too much to say here.  This place is certainly worth checking out.

5zUb-Asl1QI_VYkT7NamGA.text: Fantastic healthy food. I usually get a plate with 3 sides - all the sides are very good (eggplant and mac and cheese are probably my favorites)  The mother earth bowl is also delicious and healthy

2QoM9J1mKMFMaRYCiqB-Wg.text: Wow, great tasing vegetarian food with protein options for is no vegetarians. Salmon etc :) the food tastes super good and it's healthy. No sacrifice.

mNXaONQeMz8RXb20g88oWQ.text: Wonderful vegan friendly menu. Food is made to order so always fresh. I like the atmosphere best the lighting and indoor and outdoor seating is a plus. Great lunch or light dinner spot.

yotnSgAxR8B2aIyssZrGTA.text: My new favorite restaurant!!!!  I love that it has healthy and delicious food and many options for people that are vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, paleo, etc.   It's my go-to lunch spot during the week and I always suggest this as a spot to meet with friends as well.   The gluten free mac and cheese, smashed potatoes, steak, brownie and lemon cake are definitely worth trying. I also love the glow bowl, but I think it's seasonal and isn't on the menu anymore. The vegan ingredient salad is yummy and would recommend getting the spicy eggplant and butternut squash if you're looking for healthy sides.  I'm so happy that they have organic wine as I always get it to drink at home, but can rarely find it when I eat out. If you don't drink alcohol, the ice tea is a great alternative!!! If you're debating about trying out this place, I'd highly recommend it!

k4usPxXStPCeRsoZRImZ1g.text: I ordered the forbidden rice, which was had just the right amount of spice. The vegetables were crisp and fresh and flavorful.   We came on Mother's Day and there was a bit of a line, but a server came around and handed waiting customers the rose petal lemonade. The decor is playful and stylish and the whole restaurant has a fun vibe.

4xEh7QsO9eKrvCsHF7l1kA.text: Flower Child is the new hot restaurant in our area. We have tried it a few times (including opening week) and each experience has been fantastic. It's a fast casual concept, so you seat yourself and get your own drinks, but food arrives to your table quickly.   The decor- bright and colorful. Great indoor and outdoor spaces, with comfortable seating.   The staff- really friendly and always greets you with a smile. They have been able to describe menu items and make suggestions based on our likes.   The food- so awesome. We have tried several items and each has been worth returning for. Some of our favorites are the thai cashew bowl with salmon, the avocado hummus, and the mac and cheese.   This is one of our new favorite spots!!!!!

2z6g6dMEK9VIjD4Sx00CMw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Food is excellent and fresh! Great selection of beverages. Cool vibe and outdoor seating is wonderful!! Their bowls are off the charts. Soups and wraps are good too! Vegan and no vegan options! Something for everyone

DzfLN_YbwJNt-A2pFypNzw.text: LoveFresh, healthy and Delish! The lemon avocado dressing is heaven I will definitely be back

0GuXidCzvLHQEXHgoIuw6Q.text: Pretty sure our stomachs were the happiest campers for feeding them such delicious healthy choices during this meal!  Decided to see what the hype was all about with this place and I'm totally with the hype on this one! I'm big on the atmosphere of places and this place just gave me all the healthy, new, fun, friendly, market place vibes! Lol this place was super modern rustic totally Pinterest worthy. With as busy as it was there was no shortage of indoor and outdoor seating!  Now the food...SO FRESH. Everything tasted like it had been pulled right out of a backyard garden, seasoned and cooked to perfection, and served beautifully on your plate! I'm sure when some people think "healthy restaurant" they associate little taste/joy out of eating well, but this place has both the "good for you" and "tastes good" on lock. The fact that Flower Child is vegan friendly too is a HUGE plus for us!  *Love this place to pieces, just a tiny bit pricey - I assume it's due to all the freshness - but it won't keep me from coming back!

7X5Na_BjgrE5ASy4d2grsA.text: The food is awesome, very healthy and tasty, but adding protein $8 for small steak make my lunch be about $20 dollars. That's just too much guys.

AWUlMJ7QK9UCDqkP_kYPIQ.text: Flower Child is my new favorite place to go to when I'm in town. I love the variety of foods they have. The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly.

G7qTLc_1yMkDJu0LOwYQOA.text: RUN DO NOT WALK. GO TODAY. RIGHT NOW. This place is so amazing. It's not easy to find healthy food that is also delicious. This place also has a big menu which is really unusual in a healthy place! So good.   You order at the register and get a number and sit and wait. We went at noon and it was crowded but we got a table right away. In the future, I'd probably not risk that and go a little before or after lunch.   Everyone loved their meal. Even the bathroom was great!

9uMeb7ftMHYwa4spcR7vPg.text: I have been there twice now and each time the food and service is amazing! The first time I got the Vietnamese Crunch salad which was so good. The second time I got the gluten free Mac n cheese and curry cauliflower which were both delicious. I also got the Thai Cashew Quinoa which was out of this world! Definitely one of my faves. Going back there again today! Can't wait to try more items!

ivru9tBtRCl6gRPOP9U8Fg.text: Great, healthy options when you're looking for something quick. The atmosphere is really cute and different than anything else in the area. One of my favorite spots.

KYkCQYi_Gkzo3Jmiim1rBQ.text: I always wondered if I'd find a healthy place to accommodate everyone's needs, that wouldn't be boring and bland. Finally I've found Flower Child, and I couldn't be happier.  I've been about 4 times now, and tried about half the menu. I love some of the creations they have, however my go to is the create your own plate. There are so many options! You can have 1 single serving of broccoli, (which is my fav with the parm-garlic-lemon crust), or you can get creative and have brown rice, avocado, salmon, and green beans. So many lovely meals to be discovered!  I indulged and had a glass of wine on my most recent trip and even that was organic and of high quality.  The prices are reasonable, everything is recycled or recyclable, and they even offer non paper straws that are still not plastic! How's that for not cutting corners?  One last tip, mix the flavored lemonade and black tea. Just do it.

UXlvlCEERcBfLfwMAG7ocw.text: 4 1/2 stars! This place is a consistent hit whenever I am in the mood of eating healthy! Great salads and wraps and the bowls always look good but have never ordered them.   They have a nice environment to eat your meal! The outside patio is very cute and a great place for a casual meals with friends! I will always come back here when I'm in the mood for some greens.   It's a little pricy but to be expected at a salad/healthy restaurant! No complaints here.

-tkfC9XBZjsEj7xoVlPSAQ.text: Wow, just wow. Was looking forward to trying this place. Since I worked at a school and have a very short lunch break my coworker called in our order around 11:10 and asked that it could be ready for pickup at 1:15. All day looking forward to trying my meal from here, we both were actually. At 1 I decide to head over to pick up my food on my limited lunch hour and guess what? It's not ready. My order hasn't even been put in. There was no explanation, no apology. I had to get back to my students and now I'm leaving without my lunch.   Back to Shenker I go and hope that there's an extra lunch because this establishment has wasted my lunch break. So thank you for not only ruining my lunch and not providing it but also for wasting my 30 mins that I get off. Definitely letting people at the school know not to go here and letting them know about the horrible customer service.

mCb7g9ZOBtfPd2RWd5dQSA.text: Flower child is probably my top of the list go-to spot for healthy eats. Not only does it provide a rustic chic ambiance, but I really like the flow of the restaurant. You order,  get a number, the server brings your food over and a semi self serve service with everything you need on the shelves in the back. You can customize your sides + protein or get one of their many dishes. The open kitchen let's you see everything being whipped up fresh from scratch.  The food itself is simple but made with good quality, you can really set the difference vs Skinny Fats. Portion and quality are well worth the price.  Everything we had was delicious.

YE4P92_MIpODTJFwRoZpmg.text: I've been here a couple times with friends, and have been pretty happy with it. The restaurant is beautiful, and is a great aesthetic place to eat out.   I've had the Smashed Avocado Toast, and the Mother Earth bowl with tofu. The avocado toast is really quite delicious. And I enjoyed the bowl also. It has really yummy pesto, and a great acidic flavor. They also do a really good job of cooking the tofu so that it's not rubbery.   The only downside, Is that it's quite pricey for a little lunch/brunch place. But I'm sure it's because of the high quality of the food.

zw99XSjZ1_LFoRN9WtWOvQ.text: Omg my first time here and I will be back!! I got my food to go it was so so good  I got spicy eggplant mashed potatoes and salmon.. Now I like eggplant but this right here is so so good  it is not really spicy so don't worry about that.. The flavors are so good it's the sauce they use on top of it. By far the best eggplant I had so far..

Lg_rY8aje8C3XsqUDGJsvg.text: This place is really cute and as a vegetarian you get a little excited about places that boast healthy food. This place wasn't a let down. They have lots of vegan and vegetarian options that look super tasty. I tried the Thai Dye wrap with spicy tofu. it was really spicy and tasted amazing. The ingredients are fresh and it didn't take long to be ready.   The few things I would comment on are just how the staff interacted with me. They didn't seem to care very much and kind of rushed me through my order. I wanted take out-but the person who took my order rushed me out so quickly she had no idea. They were not super busy-so i was a little irritated to see she just wanted to continue her conversation behind the counter.   The hostess also had very long hair that was free to roam about her head and she went back and forth between where the food was being prepared and the register...mmm i'd rather not.   Though i will return...it's because the vibe and food are independent of the front of house staff. I'd say it's worth checking out...maybe call in your order.

7m-i3pcgMM-CsIU5sCog2w.text: This place is certainly very cute. If you are looking for a more healthier fare, this is a cool place to try.   If you haven't been here before, there's two lines: one for take out and one for sit down dining. You order your food at the counter and you get a number. It's open seating! I bet the patio seating up front is great during the spring time when it isn't 100 degrees outside.   I tried this place out for restaurant week because they had a 2 people for dinner for $40. Which is like getting a cookie and a drink for free. Both my friend and I came here together for a double date and my friend ordered first. She was offered choices for everything as far as soup and drinks. I specifically heard her offer kombucha to her. When it was my turn to order, I told the girl that I would like the kombucha to drink and she said that it wasn't part of it. I was like ok and opted for wine. My boyfriend and I were not offered the same options yet we were also doing the same restaurant week offer. To make things worst, they ran out of cookies and offered $5 vouchers to be used the next time.  As for the food, we tried the steak and the salmon serving. We tried both of the soups: curry and chicken soup. Their chicken soup was just broth with a shiitake mushroom. The curry cauliflower soup was rather tasty. The steak was cooked perfectly but it was tough and chewy, even though it was medium rare. The Mac and cheese had a very unique flavor and texture, which I felt indifferent about. The salmon was pretty good. I enjoyed the vegetables with it.   The best part was their cookies!!! My friend shared one with us and they were really good.  I give 3 stars to the cute ambiance, the salmon, and the cookies. Take down 2 for bad service and tough steak.  I hope to give this place another try. Hopefully the service improves and treats everyone the same.

Im6MjHH-S_1-ZJxS5f4KLw.text: It's hard to decide where to begin when talking about ethics, moral, and all the things I love about food.  Flower Child nearly does everything better than most healthy places, introducing an environment to lift the spirit with its decoration, open kitchen, and so much more - all the while maintaining the charm of a healthy place with an outstanding menu.  Despite the cost going up as you start to include additional items to your dish, this place is a well oiled machine.  You can see anywhere from 15-20 people working all at once.  But Flower Child is much more than just a place that pushes your meal out to you quickly and efficiently: they are run by, through my observation, awesome and good-hearted people.    I don't know where to begin with that.  Maybe with a personal story.  Growing up as a child, I remember one time where my mom brought me to her workplace because no one was able to watch me at the time.  But her boss had sent us home even though I was behaving!  Okay so back to the people who run Flower Child, I believe I once saw a mother working on the line while their child was sitting out at one of the tables in the restaurant, I could be wrong but I don't think I am.  I want to say that I even saw the person in charge bring the child a drink!  I'll continue to come here at least once a week and have started to branch out on the menu, not.  I still love my Mother Earth or Forbidden Rice!  Cheers Flower Child!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s hard to order anything else when it keeps coming out this good

WOIBs2etGHIdNqCzf4eVNA.text: Never in my wildest hippie dreams did I think a place like this would ever exist in Vegas. This has got to be one the cutest, hippiest spots I've ever seen. The green decor throughout and flowers everywhere has to be every influencer's dream. I don't take myself as an influencer, but if I were, I'd definitely be making my Instagram boyfriend take shots of me throughout this place.  One of the best parts about this place is that is almost runs like a casual, sit down restaurant. You go up to the counter to order, but then wait staff will bring all your food out to you, so you don't have to be listening attentively for your name. They also have a separate line for to-go and online orders (order online? LOVE!). I popped in here inbetween meetings and as I'm not a Summerlin local, I just had to have it today so I opted for the to-go line, which went rather quick.  I decided on the flying avocado, and don't worry, it's not actually flying. Only sad thing was that they ran out of wheat tortillas, but honestly, probably a good thing for me. I opted for the gluten free tortilla, which to be honest, I've always hated gluten free anything. Not this time. This tortilla truly tasted like it had all the gluten in the world (can you taste gluten? I'm not sure, but most gluten free tortillas and pastas I've had have been gross beyond reason). It was absolutely incredible. The flavors all complimented each other - gouda and avocado - what a beautiful combination. One the side, you get mixed greens with their house vinaigrette which I am now desperately needing the recipe to. It was sweet and not too tangy.  To go along with my wrap, I decided on a their house lemonade. It's pretty sweet, but probably because it's made with real lemons, which of course, are extremely sweet.   I will definitely be back again, and this time, I'll be sitting out on the covered patio because it's DARLING. Hope I make it out for a road trip to Summerlin soon because I'll be dreaming about this place until then.

nbps_2zIm22E4m0YFh_rkQ.text: I ate at flower child's on Aug/29/19 and about 3 hrs after nausea stomach pains & headache set in. I had the chicken Mack & cheese watermelon salad & avocado. it's now 12:32am and I'm still so sick. I only had food from flower child today. I put sriracha on my food the sauce is kept in the hot sun.it was about 108 here today I'm thinking that was it.

5eCdtTebNeDlXHKS93etAA.text: Running errands on the West Side had me going crazy all day in excitement wanting to try this adorable dining spot. After months and months of dying to come here, I finally decided today was the day!   After asking the cashier the best options, we settled on the "Build your own plates!"   Plate 1: Chicken with Brussels Sprouts, Sweet Potatoes, and the Mac n' Cheese!  Plate 2: Chicken with Eggplant and Brussels Sprouts!   Before I get into how all the food tasted, I want to say that the atmosphere is completely adorable! The staff is filled with good vibes to match! I just wish the food matched my emotions on the decor.   Unfortunately, when we received our food it was lukewarm! This may have started the bad taste in our mouth about the meal.   The Chicken tasted like Tyson Frozen Grilled Chicken Breast Strips and was extremely watery. The Brussel Sprouts tasted like the oil they may have been cooked in. The Mac n' Cheese tasted like a box of White Cheddar Cheez-It's! The Eggplant and Sweet Potatoes were the best on the plate and even those were only half-way decent.   To sum up the meal, it wasn't anything special. The meal tasted like it was from a microwavable box from Whole Foods. Therefore, I could make the meals for half the price and the same taste in my own kitchen! Which 100% saddens me to say because I really wanted this to be a new "must have" spot on my list.   I would love to give this place another chance, however, I don't see that happening in the near future.

tbLmpsvejhKMTaQ9pYkiNA.text: I really want to love Flower Child, but it seems like the more I eat there the more inconsistent their food is.  I've tried both the Las Vegas and Phoenix locations and they both are not even close to being consistent with their food.  It seems like a surprise each time I eat at there locations. I understand there are different chefs working each day, but  it's not rocket science to taste your food multiple times throughout the day.  In the restaurant business, quality and consistency is everything!

Byt8rgFb3hwRIsSAdF882g.text: Knew of this place as it is part of a group that owns north Italia and culinary dropout, so when they offered their menu items on a restaurant week special it was time to try it.  Their deal was 2 for $40 dinner. So took my sons to give it a shot.  Their menu was 3 courses and drink. Soup - they tried the Thai chicken, entree - grass fed steak with smashed potatoes, gluten free Mac and cheese and sauteed broccoli. Dessert was a chocolate chip cookie.  The drink choices was one of their in house made lemonade or a local beer.  The entrees that the boys had were good. They enjoyed the steak and mashed.  Mac and cheese not as much. I had the wrap which was on their menu for restaurant week but I bought separately as we had 3 people in our party. The wrap was good, the tortilla was a slightly different texture and was filled with lettuce avocado hummus tomatoes and a small amount of turkey. Could have been more turkey.   The side was a spring mix salad that was lightly dressed.   Overall the flavor of the food was good.  A one off for me. Would be enjoyed by those looking for gluten free, vegan healthy overall options.

Jqzxw578uvCzF4UlpaQ9rg.text: Upscale healthy food. Not often do straight healthy restaurant. Flower Child adds different twist or option comes to healthy dining.  First impression was fan of the interior design and the vibe of the restaurant. No doubt everything about it screams healthy from the menu. The different fresh lemonade options. The use of super food ingredients in most or all the menu. The interior design feels spring in the air.   I ended up ordering the forbidden rice bowl add beef. It was very healthy, light, refreshing, and colorful. The different carbs not only added lot of flavor, texture, and color. Really great idea! Add beef gave it more volume and hearty. The beef had great flavor! I could have got bowl of beef over rice traditional style be happy. Portion size was decent.  Overall would recommend Flower Child looking to eat healthy. The service was five stars!

eyFhUBlktxtAUBYXTXGbYQ.text: I give the decor and set up 5 stars. It was super cute and trendy in there. Parking was easy and the food came out in a timely manner.   The food... ok so we had: Avacado toast- I feel that toast society is much better and I was honestly surprised how small of a slice of toast it was for the $7-$8  Spicy Japanese Eggplant- if you like eggplant then this was very tasty and enjoyable. Maybe because I had all these different foods it seemed a tad over powering as far as flavor.   Red chili glazed sweet potato- hands down the best item, I would order that alone it was so good.   Mother Earth Bowl with Chicken- I mean it was a salad and it was good... I was surprised how well the broccoli pesto and miso vinaigrette tasted together as I would never put those flavors together.   Overall Flower Child was okay... I personally wouldn't drive from Henderson to Summerlin again to have it, but my best friend loves it so I'm sure I'll be back. And I'm more of a soda fountain consumer so the kombucha on tap threw me off as I was really looking for a nice cold Diet Coke.

KBGRs-LR0iwP8Bv2UDsUwQ.text: I started following @eatflowerchild on IG when I saw their sign go up months back! I was so excited that we were offered the chance to join them in Soft Opening / Training Day for Flower Child! I was already anticipating amazing food just by their IG! But when we checked in and saw the menu I couldn't just order one thing!   It was my co-workers and I, who were able to check out the new spot. We ordered the Avocado Hummus, Crushed Avocado Toast and Vietnamese Crunch Salad to share at the table. We loved the toast and hummus! Those were two items that we would come back for time and time again! The toast had the perfect amount of avocado and the sliced egg was in every bite! Yummy!!! The hummus came with thin pita slices, but that avocado hummus was well made and it was so smooth and delicious!!   As far as our meals, we had 2 3-side plates and a Rebel wrap. The portion size is excellent! It's enough to get you full and satisfied but not overly stuffed! I had the green beans, sweet potatoes, and eggplant with steak. The best side I had was the eggplant! I loved the sauce it was served with plus the cashews were an amazing addition to it!! The steak was well prepared and it was the perfect amount for all the sides!  The staff was friendly and super helpful with the ordering process and they always made sure our plates were cleared and we had everything we needed as we enjoyed our meal.   I'm intrigued to try the rest of the menu and their different flavored lemonades! Though it's a little far for me, I'd definitely come back! It's a beautiful location and the layout is super cute!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crushed Avocado Toast
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Hummus
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qrUjmtU7TudG3Esv2TDt-g.text: This place was amazing. All of the food was so delicious. They service was great. All of the staff were friendly and polite. Orders came out quick. Perfect place to go on the weekends for a girls lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuuuummmmmm

FnVr2UUdE3qoZn4DA2W_Kw.text: Loved this place. Me and my husband got the hummus and macaroni. Everything was so good. The staff was awesome, the came around quit often and cleared plates, they also offered us more pita for our hummus. I'm also not a big fan of lemonade, but they have the best strawberry lemonade! I will definitely be coming back.

GJorplNF3F1JfiPhLzWbKQ.text: I am obsessed. This place is super cute and colorful! It's a lot bigger than I had expected. From the outside, I did not expect such a large dining area. They also have an outdoor shaded sitting area if you're wanting a little more fresh air which is just as nicely decorated as the inside.   The service is impeccable and I received my food in a timely manner. I had the Mother Earth bowl which had ancient grains, sweet potato, portobello mushroom, avocado, cucumber, broccoli pesto, charred onions, leafy greens, red pepper miso vinaigrette, and hemp seed. It was the perfect blend of flavor and was very fulfilling. They give you the option to add protein but it was just fine as is. I also ordered their seasonal lemonade. They hand you a cup and you have the option to choose from the 3 different flavors they have displayed. I went for the cucumber mint lemonade which was so refreshing and you can really taste the cucumber. Refills are allowed so I definitely went back for more before I stepped back out into the Vegas heat that day. I look forward to trying more of their other food options.   I was quite impressed by how fulfilling their food was. Considering most vegetarian/vegan or any kind of healthy food spot leaves me hungry after 5 minutes, I actually didn't have to eat dinner after this place. If you do go, I recommend getting the Mother Earth bowl. It didn't seem like much but it was actually the perfect serving. Enjoy!

uXlVksmUC4ntukO3Z-ouqg.text: Beautiful & trendy new hangout spot in Summerlin. Equal indoor & outdoor seating with a really colorful happy vibe to it. My girlfriend & I loved it & will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B2qMqTVCXqNDUHXrdIqu0w.text: Yummy healthy food!!!  I love coming here! The food is always on point and the wait time is not bad either, it's so fun to see them make the food with the open kitchen :)

fYNY1ryrEHcskfuCIBSKEA.text: I'm in love with this place! It's so amazing. The place is beautiful I love the decor and pretty much everything lol.   We came in and didn't know if we had to order first or go sit down and wait for a waitress so I asked the guy at the register and he was so nice and friendly and told us how it all worked so we placed our order and went to go get our drinks and the way they have their lemonades and utensils set up it's so cute.   We decided to sit down outside and it was so nice our waitress came and dropped our food she was also very nice she also picked up our plates when we were done.   We ordered the Mother Earth bowl with steak and it was so delicious after eating it, I felt so refreshed the lemonade was very delicious too. The best part is all the food is healthy and I thought it was gonna be expensive but it's not :)   Will I be back soon? Of course! I would eat here everyday if there was one closer to my house.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu :)
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So cute!
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have free water :)

0-IonXCmPvI6r3sqTMeqhQ.text: What an incredible meal. From the moment you walked in, the staff could not have been more friendly or welcoming.   We browsed the menu and made our selections, which wasn't easy because everything looked so amazing. The avocado toast was hearty with perfectly cooked eggs on top. Only suggestion my husband had would be to add a few fresh tomatoes, I could go either way with that.   I ordered the Mother Earth with Salmon (5/5) and my partner ordered the Strawberry Fields with no additions (5/5). On the side we tried the Spicy Japanese Eggplant (top of our list!).   We will absolutely be back, this area needed a restaurant like this!

gHjpxPMNmBVqS1pdMoy75Q.text: This place was so yummy and cute!! The staff was extremely friendly and Eric was very helpful to my girlfriends and I who were having a mini baby shower. Can't wait to come here again soon!

Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SMNPl1no0gbmkew-1K1MUQ.text: HEALTHY UPSCALE This place does healthy really well in a casual way. You order at counter and they bring to your table. A cool modern industrial vibe - a bit feminine feel. Friendly service folks. Nice avocado toast appetizer (a bit on the small side). We enjoyed our salads and plates. The only catch was it's not cheap. $18 per person without any drinks or tip. I would hesitate to come back - "it's good but do I want to spend that much?" Maybe or maybe not. Ps It was packed for lunch on Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order at counter style.

6_dbWSihIkTuMFZzDF9Wgg.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. The Forbidden Rice Bowl is an absolute banger. I don't mind driving the extra distance just to enjoy a bowl of heaven. Eat well & you live well. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

le8MFKn0FcvB1F-tAjo1Ng.text: OK, THIS VENUE IS LIKE A BREATH OF FRESH AIR!  I LOVE everything about this place!  The ambiance, decor, service and especially the food!!   The large open dining area is casual yet very chic, comfy and very inviting.   You walk in and there are two areas to order. One cashier (far left) is for carry-out, and the other two cashiers (right) are for dine in orders. They were quite busy, and I appreciated how patient the cashier was with me as I tried to decide what to order from their extensive menu. I'm not a fan of raw kale, but my girlfriend highly recommended it so we ordered the kale salad and avocado toast, which I love. You pay for your meal and they give you a number for your order to place on your table.   Even before the food arrived, I enjoyed just sitting there and soaking in the upbeat, vibrant atmosphere! I tried a bite of the kale salad and instantly regretted that I did not order it for myself! The fibrous, chewy spine of the kale was removed and the leafy green was finely chopped and I loved it, raw, to my surprise! The citrusy light dressing, mild cheeses and seeds made it an amazing flavorful and textural combination, and a culinary delight for my palate! I'm craving it now as I write about it now.  If you are in the area, definitely check it out. However, it is worth checking out regardless which side of town you are coming from!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Organic Kale salad with salmon and their crushed avocado toast

qnK5fg_a7GJfxY2y65jI3w.text: Great addition in Summerlin. This is the 9th location on a Phoenix based restaurant. The food was great- health choices, taste good, only thing is a little bit expensive for what you get.  Service is great.  Clean and sleek place.  Tried the pick 3 with grass fed steak- got the sauteed spinach, sauteed eggplant-yum-, and green beans.  No soda but have local beers. Definitely coming back to try other meals in the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dP0ECr_JjicYBc9X4KajTQ.text: This was my first time coming here. I've been meaning to check it out for awhile. I love that this place is in my neck of the woods. I only came here to pick up an order though. I didn't get to experience the dining yet. I will definitely come back to try. The place itself is very cute. I instantly felt joyful when stepping foot inside. The restaurant is very spacious and the decor is a mix of floral (hence the name of place) and greenery arrangements. I ordered the Strawberry Fields salad which was the perfect combination of yumminess and very light yet I was still full after eating it. I knocked off a star only because when I arrived i didn't know the drill since I was picking up. People were kind of standing around but no direction given as to where to pick up our food?! I just happened to glance over and saw my salad sitting on the side on a shelf. Other than that I truly enjoyed my salad and the place itself is just too cute! I can't wait to come back with friends to dine in.

psJqoK9n7CwWD_fed3L1yg.text: What an awesome addition to the neighborhood!  We came pre-opening night. From the moment we walked up, staff were friendly and welcoming. You order at the counter and choose a table-many seating options both inside and outside. The decor is reminiscent of a farmhouse-albeit modernized. Food came fairly quickly. My daughter had the forbidden rice with chicken. She describes the chicken as being cooked to perfection. Her veggies were very fresh and the flavor was impeccable. The Mac and cheese was quite tasty - made with a sharp mixture-a good tone of Parmesan. The vegan poke bowl was filled with fresh, well marinated veggies. Kombucha on tap - delish. We finished off with a gluten-free brownie which was good yet crumbly. It needs more moisture and less time in the oven. Very chocolatey. We will certainly be back!! Can't wait to try more dishes off the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2CbsnWZI2q5L2UDKPiImKw.text: Love this place. I literally eat here every time I'm by myself and want a special treat. It's so yummy and healthy. I don't eat out a lot when I'm not entertaining clients or friends but when I do I eat here!!  Mother Earth is my go to dish!!! Sooooo good!!!

MeiWFVyKVESAeQNL2sKm7g.text: We had wanted to dine in today but there was a line and it was so loud and noisy, we ordered wraps to go instead and never mind the long wait.   The Rebel wrap ($13) had very little grass-fed beef and with the arugala overpowering the wrap, it did not taste good at all.  The Free Spirit chicken wrap ($12) was very good BUT had a lot of whole almonds which were all too hard, after biting into a couple of them, I had to pull and throw them all away before I break a tooth.  Very expensive but I wanted to try Flower Child for several months now.  Big disappointment.

EDOs06dxtGrm1JvCjFUFaA.text: I really adore this place. It has something for everyone. Amazing vegan options and for pescatarians and meat eaters, it's all organic and humanely raised, etc. Fresh made infused teas, amazing herbs and fruits... and their lemonades are wonderful. Fresh brewed kombucha on tap. It's so good and it fills up and gets busy... sometimes hard to find a parking spot... but it's worth the wait!

uwuqW1Qnka5pJc7hoFF1Nw.text: I tend to review positive experiences!! I like good news, good food, and being genuinely happy. The food at Flower Child, is good and makes me feel good! It's smart, it's healthy, it's delicious! Healthy living does taste good! I need more!!

c1tiykDTW8LOcAq5xieOMw.text: I am absolutely obsessed with Flower Child! You never have to wait a long time for your food and their food always tastes fresh and delicious! This is my new lunch and dinner spot in Summerlin!

t54oQseNQVyToIK7cl4Kiw.text: Great vegan place. Great ambiance. Good portion for the price. Definitely a must try place for people who like healthy meals and salads.

unzdKWWxQwTvwKU3ZqbrxQ.text: Well this place surprised me. I have a couple friends whom are vegan, which I think is amazing, but the food choices are typically not. This place is an exception. The steak wrap was way better than expected. It was seasoned just enough to match with the rest of the flavors. The flying avocado was decent, I wouldn't get it again due to it being a bit bland. The mixed greens which come along with the meal is basic, but delicious as well. Enjoy!

kcNA2Fo4amuinMjdb8R6ZA.text: I am completely obsessed with this restaurant and so happy to have it in Summerlin! This area was definitely in need of a restaurant like this. I love that it is fast casual, The ambience is amazing and inviting . Now , the food ! I have been four times and Everything I have had has been great . ..I can't wait to try the whole menu. The Thai cashew salad with salmon is absolutely my favorite and the avocado lemon dressing is delicious ! I hope the service stays great , everyone that works there is very helpful and on top of it! Maybe more cashiers ? Sometimes a long line

J-1HdOVaRArehEedY6afLA.text: The food here was pretty good! I went with my boyfriend and we both enjoyed it. He got the steak plate with Mac & cheese and mashed potatoes. I'm not going to lie, when they brought it out it looked really plain and I was kind of scared that there wasn't going to be any flavor. But omg, when we both tried it, it was so good! Every thing was very flavorful! I was surprised, lol. I got the skinny cob salad with chicken and it was good too! I love how they weren't greedy with their dressing! And the lemonade was good too! Very refreshing! It's a bit pricey but I would definitely recommend this place.

8LlAtbknw1tEqSyk3Da-HA.text: This is our second time here and all I can say is the food is amazing. We will no doubt comeback again and again. The Flying Avocado is now one of my favorites and the wife loved the Skinny Cobb. Great job Flower Child!

v0TxE4ciFaWSE8opuGrXLA.text: This is literally the best place ever i never had a salad like there's it's pretty awesome i love the environment i was pretty shook cause I'm not the healthier types of people but wow i never thought it would be that that good

4W5DT5BWTzgYBjWoxkJdfA.text: Great atmosphere there was a little line out the door around noonish but it went quick.. first time there and it was good.. I ordered the 3 item w spicy eggplant curried cauliflower and green beans no protein because I'm content with that... it was a little salty I must admit but it was non the less great tasting... they have a cute little condiment station along with crayons and a etch-a-sketch that my little loved...
