5Ht253cilhFVW85rNvNl5Q.text: A little pricey but super delicious! Definitely coming back for the Forbidden Rice w/shaved beef

m_68S41dYcj7sPQmO5H5bw.text: Decided to try this place. Very crowded and line to order food. Got take out and was ready within 15 minutes. Ordered one of the salads with salmon and was very fresh and tasty. Would definitely go back and try some of the other items.

-gT4cOiKLmhJk3V353pkqw.text: Cute place.  Great location.  Extremely salty food.  I was excited to take my mom and a friend here, but we were all very disappointed when we bit into our meals.  Mom, and I, ordered the turkey wraps which were SO SALTY we couldn't even finish them.  I believe that the turkey used is a processed turkey similar to the packaged turkey I could buy in Walmart, if I chose to buy such low-grade turkey.  My friend had a tofu wrap.  She said that the mixture of flavors wasn't well thought out.  She finished her wrap reluctantly.  The lemonade was good, but I won't be returning.  P.S.  $45 was too much for the quality of the food!

5JvpdQVZrbgCKO__AqXH4g.text: Wow this place can potentially replace my love for vegenation. Although, this is not an all vegan spot they have plenty of vegan options! Their main categories consists of salads, plates, bowls and wraps. I ended up going with a plate that consisted of three options. The three options I picked were Indian spiced cauliflower, red chili glazed sweet potatoes and spicy jalapeno eggplant, I topped it off with tofu as my protein. To sum it all up WOW! All of the choices for my plate where amazing 5/5 stars. My sister had bird is the word and she added avocado hummus. She didn't enjoy the grilled onions in side but loved the side salad 3/5 stars. We also had a fresh brewed beverage. I tried all of them and alone non of them were really that enjoyable. However, if you make an Arnold Palmer it's ok. Finally, customer service was amazing very friendly and helpful staff.

O6S4AVNKge30kg5M5Pch_Q.text: My Girlfriend is Vegan and had mentioned the place to me a while ago.  We finally made it in and I was more than satisfied with the entire experience.  The menu caters to all facets of your dietary needs/wants.  There is optional protein choices (steak, salmon, and chicken) to add to any dish you choose.  The choices for Vegetarian, Vegan, and Gluten Free dishes was extensive and not boring as you may find in typical Vegan or Vegetarian restaurants.  I had the Mother Earth bowl with added chicken.  Not only was the dish aesthetically pleasing, it was an explosion of flavor that my taste buds couldn't get enough of!  I felt like I couldn't get the food in my mouth fast enough.  The atmosphere was vibrant and fun, decor was perfectly quaint, and the staff was absolutely wonderful.  A definite must if you have been on the fence about going.

woHG8ZEys7WOqlZKPgFElw.text: I'm obsessed. They have the best menu in town and their staff is awesome. It's the perfect place for lunch or a nice bite for dinner. If I could eat there everyday I would. Thanks for being so awesome! Flower Child!

LAsfA4yfA3Bh3fjc7giHlA.text: This place is so good! Little pricey, but the food is full of flavor and it's NOT drenched in butter! I got the salmon with grilled asparagus and cauliflower.   It was delicious! I would definitely recommend it.

9uHCXJhUpKRCinx_KLV_mg.text: This is some of the best vegan food you can find in Las Vegas. We came out here after a friend recommended it and it was to die for!

qXdOk8ji7CFltlYjIkJgRQ.text: Fresh, fun, healthy food in a great atmosphere. Doesn't feel like Las Vegas inside, and sometimes that can be a good thing. I enjoyed the Vietnamese Crunch salad, which was delish. Also, the flavored black tea was the best tea I've ever had anywhere. Looking forward to returning very soon.

NmJvR18tswE8kuHD5d8f3w.text: My review is titled "Faux Avocado".    Here is the rub.  My wife and I both love fresh avocado.  This restaurant is new in the Summerlin area and we were excited to give it a try.  When I saw "Smoked Turkey Wrap with Avocado" and she saw "Avocado Toast" on the menu we were sold.  Here is the sad part...Don't advertise "avocado" unless you are going to use real fresh avocado.  We were very disappointed.  What they served me on the wrap and her on the toast reminded us of the frozen stuff that came in a plastic dish in the market.  It was watery, tasteless, and resembled very little of fresh avocado.  They concocted some form of mixture that just didn't work.  I am giving this place two stars (not one) because I love the concept of healthy fresh food and atmosphere.  When they decide to serve real avocado instead of faux avocado I will certainly come back.  In the meanwhile I really want to give them a second chance but will stay away from the smoked turkey wrap with "faux" avocado and "faux" avocado toast.

SjAxsBZAW6ZmFzePye70Pw.text: Love it!!! Everything was delicious, plus the vibe in there is very welcoming. The line goes by pretty fast so when you walk in don't become discouraged, the food is worth it :)

rAGfjupSp2TEYAiWjp7O1g.text: I could eat here everyday! Lots of fresh, tasty and healthy entrees to choose from! Salad with salmon is my favorite! Filet is cooked perfectly. Satisfying portions. One try you'll become a regular. Quick togo service.

no0NZbgeG1__hJMW4BlI_g.text: What an adorable place! Stopped in on my lunch break and ordered the Vegan Poke with a Rose Petal Lemonade. It was pretty busy inside, but I was in and out in less than 10 minutes for my to-go order. The staff was so friendly and upbeat, making it such a great atmosphere - a positive little break in the day. The Vegan Poke was so perfect. It's got a lot of beets, which I've never been fond of, but this might put beets back on the menu for me! I added tofu, which had the flakey consistency, acting as a convincing pass for salmon. The Rose Petal Lemonade was refreshing, but not quite enough Rose - just seemed like regular lemonade. Add more Rose, Flower Child, please!!  So thankful this gem is so close to work

TSRYiO-IaWXCIfpk2NLYSg.text: Pricy for what you get but everything tastes fresh and delicious. Portions aren't large but I was full off my meal which doesn't happen very often, lol!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

20yNf0363fmOGSGWHNZE7A.text: I am so happy flower child opened so close to home, summerlin needed a healthy place to eat, with selection, and fun environment, plus dog friendly which always makes me happy :) I have been there many many times now and the food is always reliable, also the home made cookies that are gluten free WOW sooo good! The forbidden rice-try it you'll love it  All the wraps are great can't choose a favorite   Salads so fresh and filling, you just leave full with no regrets   Share the avacado toast or get as a light lunch yummm

NsRDZPjl-1rxUsBZTldUgg.text: Interesting combinations of food that vary from sweeter to savory. Their pairings are available with meat or chicken but can be vegan or vegetarian. The food is tasty and service is above average. It would be helpful if items were labeled as a hot or cold food item. Their lemon muffins are fantastic!!

1b4VjoTscLK0EmutMda2vg.text: New. Favorite. Restaurant.  Discovered Flower Child just a day before they opened, in passing. Then, miraculously *cough* an ad popped up on my Facebook letting me know that it was to open the next day! Excited, I took my sister and her boyfriend with me on opening day and we all loved it SO much that I brought my boyfriend with me the very next day!  The atmosphere is wonderful. Very Instagram-y and it really has this cute California vibe. When you walk in, you will find a to-go ordering counter and a dine-in ordering counter. Dining in, you'll place an order, they'll give you a number stand and you find your own table where they'll bring your food out to you.  The menu is medium-ish sized, but the number of combinations you can make with all of the items are endless. In the two times I've gone, I ordered the Avocado Toast (10/5!!! AMAZING) and the Mother Earth bowl (5/5). I can't tell you just how much I loved both. I added two proteins to my bowl: the Tofu (5/5) and the Salmon (5/5). The Avocado Toast is the best I've ever had (and I am a HUGE avocado toast fan) and all of the ingredients of the bowl are PHE-NOM-ENAL! The Tofu is a super firm, seasoned tofu. It's delicious and unlike any store-bought tofu I've ever tried. The Salmon was cooked perfectly with even a little crispiness around the edges.  The Avocado Toast was and will likely always be my all-time favorite. The avocado is roughly mashed, still chunky. They top it with crunchy sea salts (yum!), black sesame seeds, white cheddar (I mean, WOW) and chunks of soft-boiled eggs (droooooool). The coolest part is that they cut the toast into 3 slices for easy eating! NO mess and NO falling ingredients!  Opening days for restaurants can sometimes be pretty obviously hectic, stressful and a bit of a chaotic mess (even for the patrons). However, despite the line of customers out the door, service was quick, friendly, polite and extremely seamless! I was very impressed and I couldn't wait to come back the next day with my boyfriend to share in the amazingness that is Flower Child. (FYI: he LOVED it. And he didn't think he was going to!) I will be back. Again and again and again and again...

7au0_j3vGEYVbl7wxc8stg.text: I love the food here and the staff, its my go to now over cheesecake factory for a quick fun delicious meal and the house made teas are out of this world! I have yet to try anything i didn't enjoy here and I'm thinking this is gonna be my new meal prep spot (kids portions) yes i gave you the secret thank me later xo!

lPl1SO2jFQsH2sGDzTnOug.text: We still come here all the time because the food is excellent and the service is wonderful. Tonight was a perfect example! We ordered two dishes and a soup, my dish took quite a while to come out, and when they delivered it the server was very apologetic for it taking so long and said that the manager will refund us our entire meal. I didn't complain or anything about it taking a long time. This is something that never ever happens in restaurants anymore my husband and I were very pleasantly surprised about how the manager handled the situation! The service here just continues to be the best in town and we will certainly be back! We love FC!

GCdd8IOO_HyZXUEfqzyNkg.text: It's a good place to grab some brunch at, they serve delicious vegan, vegetarian and gluten free food that actually tastes good! My boyfriend takes me here once in a while and I like it. The atmosphere is very cute and there's a nice outdoor area if you have pets and want to sit down and enjoy your food. At first I was skeptical but when I tasted my Mother Earth bowl it wasn't bad at all!

0DqTyjF4pt_3P7Ghm3wUSw.text: An amazing place to find healthy and delicious food. They had homemade rose pedal lemonade -my favorite.  Since it was my first time -they helped me understand what their menu was all about.   Every thing tempted me ! Yummy deserts too!

qDzmgb2rJPK9gouKu8bvgQ.text: i love this place, its very nice and clean and has everything a great restaurant should have. i was disappointed when i realized that the salad i ordered was missing 3 of its ingredients. i understand it was a mistake but i'm confused on how it happened. other than that, its an amazing place and i highly recommend!!

5KO0oj1PEnpc5j3smId3Aw.text: I might be a little bit obsessed with this restaurant after discovering it this past weekend. I've been there twice already! It's got a great atmosphere, the employees are upbeat and helpful, and the food is delicious and so fresh! On my first visit I had a grilled tofu plate with three sides, and my husband had the Vietnamese crunch bowl with salmon. We were both extremely happy with our meals. We also shared the avocado hummus - yuuuum! On my second visit I had the Mother Earth bowl with the tofu and it was just as good! Even though this is a bit of a drive for me, I'll be a frequent flyer here!

AJb3Pyw5KgNqQsl1u6vgSw.text: I went to Flower Child for the first and I really enjoyed it. Oh and my furry son got to join me on the patio which makes me wanna go back even more.

m14K7sG2jygz-ihLqqlVeQ.text: Good and bad here. The bad is the portion size with the price for the plate options, also the salmon. Please see pic of the eggplant plate order. zx04YQ8EHmtbwuKdEwNsoA.text: I have been hearing a lot about this place and have been hesitant to try because I wasn't impressed by the menu. It seems overpriced for simple items. I decided to try it today after a hard workout at the gym since I felt like I should eat something "healthy". I got the mashed potatoes, spicy eggplant and salmon plate to go. Wow. It was so delicious. I have been missing out on this all this time! Now, how healthy is this? I'm not sure. I wish there's calories listed on the menu. It's healthy probably because the portion size is SMALL. The $7 salmon is about the size of the palm of my hand. I feel hungry after my meal, and that's already after letting the food "sit" for awhile. And I'm not even a big eater (I usually cannot finish my meal in one sitting). I will definitely come back again, but might have to add on more items, although I'm not sure about paying $20+ for simple mashed potatoes and salmon in a casual fast food type of a restaurant. Ok, I'm seriously still hungry. I need to go look for more food now.

RzYNSMfb6K2-u9zft6kU8w.text: This place has great wraps and healthy options.  It is more on the pricier side but the ingredients are fresh and good quality.  My steak wrap was filling and the sweet potato side hit the spot. Good place for vegans and meat eaters alike. Easy going ambiance with indoor and outdoor seating.  I don't think they have an official military discount, but when I asked they gave me one anyways. I was impressed by their customer service. Staff was friendly and helpful.  I will be returning here for sure.

u7sOzhkc0w3Dx3fIp7OiRw.text: First time to Flower Child and I will say my family and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. I love restaurant's that commit to providing great customer service. And Flower Child far exceeded any expectations we had. It's definitely a laidback environment from my perspective.   As for the food, we all ordered different items. But I ordered a plate with 3 sides and a protein (salmon). My sides were sweet potatoes, mixed fruit, and spinach. I don't know what mojo they put on the spinach, but I'm definitely craving more. It makes eating healthy fun and easy, can't wait to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QvPAcTiNxhVBQVjvVeu8sQ.text: 3  - This falls under, Ok, would't mind to go once in a long time.  Flower Child is a nice concept, relaxing backyard ambiance, with light woodsy and white tablecloth colors.  This takes to the backseat of the food.  The food portion is average, who said health food has to be average portioned?  Engorge me on health food, please.  Make me fat!    I ordered the grass fed beef wrap, a bit on the salty and saucy side, I really wished I got a bit more food.  Tasted good, like a yogurt braised roast beef kind of meat sauce.  While I liked everything, it's just not something I would feel a serious craving for.

pL5J9G1X9OaAUJpiUVs6KQ.text: Coming from an actual flower child, I absolutely love this place!!  I visit Flower Child at least once or twice a month. I have tried almost every item on the menu and love the quality of their products. The items that always keep me coming back is their Bird Is The Word wrap & their Organic Kale salad. I've had my fair share of salads, but there's just something about their cheese, almonds, and kale that makes it really unique. I also love how they shred/chop the kale so I'm not eating a whole leaf.  It isn't often that I see an establishment that has kombucha on tap and that's something I love about Flower Child, too. I would also recommend trying their lemon cupcakes. They're just the perfect amount of sweet and lemon that you need! In regards to their vegan options, you can modify items in the menu to substitute or even take out. So that gives me a peace of mind if I'm ever wanting to try something "vegan style".  The ambiance of the restaurant is fun and playful. Every decoration in this place definitely shows that someone really put the time and effort to make everything come together.   The service is fast, efficient, and friendly. I feel like I'm at a friend's house when I visit here! It can get really busy during lunch time but the staff there still remains chill.   My only concern would be the slight confusion of getting served. The first few times I came into Flower Child, I didn't realize the drinks were self-serviced, along with the utensils and sauces. The only thing really being delivered to you is the food! The way I compare this store is to Skinny Fats. You get a table number, you sit anywhere that's available and you get your own drinks and what not!

ezLaZXCkfKGwpuVYMpo-3w.text: This place is awesome!  We had the gf mac and cheese, forbidden rice bowl with shaved steak, salmon, and several veggie sides.  Everything was tasty and well done.  They don't skimp on portions and prices are reasonable for what you're getting.  Looking forward to coming back and trying some of their salads.

dW_uZdw5r1Lpm8piwKvxeQ.text: This review is way overdue with how often I visit this place. As the name suggests, it's a healthier, fairly pretentious(they have a "yoga mat parking spot" possibly for those coming from TruFusion) joint in Summerlin falling smack dab in the middle of two of some of my favorite other restaurants North Italia and Honey Salt. Its menu boasts fancy salads, wraps, grain bowls, and vegan or gluten-free versions of popular dishes, along with a plethora of simple sides. What I absolutely love about this place is that all the food possesses wonderful flavor and quality, which isn't compromised by how healthy it is so you feel really good walking out of there, and it's very reasonably priced (a full tummy for around $10). My favorites include: the yuzu brussel sprouts, the butternut squash, and the mac and cheese, however I've tried so much of the menu and I've really never been disappointed! It has a cute, casual, and bright/refreshing atmosphere inside and to sum up how I really feel about this place...if I had to give up all the unhealthy food I indulge in for a healthier diet, I would gladly do so if all healthy food tasted like how it does here.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3iB21xfNrTJ0NQCF-JtYAA.text: Staff very friendly. You walk in and the atmosphere is very light and airy. There are complimentary water decanters, on a table outside and inside. You walk up look at the menu, order, your given a number placard, find seating, and they bring you your food. Optional tables and booth seating. So many options along with proteins if you want added. I personally loved their lemonade. Parking is ample,  but usually very packed.

KKII9IZGNRmG4GgsFArLiA.text: Its a pretty place .. but the food was not worth the price almost 40 buck barely and food  2 meals ..

Why4kAlrYP-AKERoIEOPPA.text: Um...YAH!!  This place is SO good!  It was our first visit, and I was part of a party of 4.  We all got something different, including the avocado hummus appetizer.  Everyone sampled each others dishes and the verdict was the same...."Oh my gosh this is SO good!"  We all ended up adding salmon to our bowls or plates, and it was fresh, flavorful and delicious.  Plenty to the serving size...two of us took home leftovers, two pigged out and ate it all.    Very casual atmosphere, and also a covered "open air" dining space.  The staff was friendly.  The price was reasonable for the exceptional quality of food.  We went on a Wednesday evening and there was no trouble getting a seat for our group.  I noticed a few posts made comments about the service, which is kind of an oxymoron to me as you order at the counter, get a number and pick your own table, self-serve drinks if you aren't purchasing alcohol or a bottled drink, and then the food is delivered to your table.  Not much customer service involved in my mind but...  If you're open to new tastes and like to try different foods - don't hesitate to check this place out.

eY8_OqvairK2btsXb54U1Q.text: Delicious food and very friendly staff! My wife and I recently starting eating vegan and being very conscious about what we are consuming. The menu is very accommodating and delicious at the same time.

4BneLPVpaHxNc6rqUKimXw.text: My favorite healthy option when it comes to dinner . Love this place great atmosphere, staff is amazing and food is delicious no doubt , had little slight disappointment when ordered online couple of days ago it was Mother Earth with salmon, when went to pick up the order I was told that they are out of Salmon and if I was okay with chicken instead was disappointed but had no choice , and when order was given to me I was just handed the container in my hand , wasn't offered a bag which was kind a rude I had to ask for it , my understanding is it should be in bag already. Just wanted to share my view, but overall my favorite place to eat , I always eat there . Love it :)

IlUpacAcWXGXbygUhgXygA.text: Let me preface this review by mentioning that I'm not vegan or vegetarian.  The food here was so so good! I had the Forbidden Rice and it was incredibly tasty. I live that all the items on the menu are clearly marked Gluten free, vegan or vegetarian but you still have the option to add grass fed steak, chicken or farm raised salmon. I chose the grass fed steak. It was perfect. Will definitely be back and next time I might bring my vegan son along lol

rbqCk3gDjClwBWgQmDEjaA.text: Delicious, clean, nice staff.  If you're looking for healthy,  this is a must try.  Menu is simple and portion is on point. Glad to have this option in vegas.

KYHnsWuIQtYh95NMDzHwRQ.text: So excited this restaurant opened up in Vegas! 10/10 my new favorite restaurant in Vegas. So quick, clean, and healthy! What more could you want?  The atmosphere is super cute, clean, and healthy. There's tons of seating inside and outside with fans. It does get very busy during peak hours, so during those times it's harder to get a seat.  They have meals that are already customized or you can customize your own plate of food with a protein and carb of your choice. I love the salads that they have!  Favorite spot in Summerlin.

2aHc8Cjwz-3Ls_UzXyAowg.text: Have been here a few times in the last year, food has been enjoyable. Get there last Thursday at 730PM and leave at 815PM to discover someone has broken my window and stolen personal effects from the car. Security tells me this is the 8th break in since December. Property has cameras, but they only point towards the businesses.   With a name like Flower Child, you'd think the place would be more concerned about my health and safety. Enter at your own risk!

0LnRpxkmd-uMIHmfC4QW7g.text: Trendy, fresh & friendly, what more do you need! If you are not about the new self serve trend you are seeing more and more, than this place is not for you! For the others though, quick and healthy food is readily available for you!   Don't be deceived by the long line should you drive by as people typically are just pondering on what amazing dish they should get. This place offers a variety of choices and the option to add protein to just about any dish! Friendly staff and quick service. The Vietnamese salad still remains my favorite with the Thai cashew bowl coming in second. However it is on the salty side. Clearly being here 2x within a week it's my go to spot. I'll be sure to update you on some other dishes my tastebuds enjoy and share them with all you foodies.

Xk3wBFq_yo6zWhgPO676yw.text: Tried the Late Riser bowl.... delicious...I have to try making it at home.  I could eat this for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

RwUOIDcSLpwIscz1txn96A.text: We went here today for lunch after craving something new and healthy. Flower Child makes a nice first impression - gorgeous outdoor patio, very welcoming interior. This restaurant is fast casual, so be prepared to wait in a short line to look at the menu and order before sitting.  The menu consists of a few salads, bowls, drinks, and sides. Lots of typical, trendy, "millenial" buzz word foods like avocado toast, quinoa, and hummus. Most items are vegetarian/vegan and then you have the option of adding a protein like salmon, grass fed beef, or tofu. I liked that the menu clearly labeled foods that were vegan and vegetarian and had the option of adding meat. I got the Vietnamese Salad, which ended up being a bit underwelming. The bulk of the salad was crunchy white cabbage strings that just arent satisfying the way greens would have been. I liked the avocado and pineapple in the salad though!   As we were eating, I started to notice details. Every table had a bottle and a little plant (we had thistle flowers), the restaurant's token hashtag was prominelty displayed, and every corner felt "instagramable." The more I looked, the more I realized this place is like a character of what they think 20-somethings want. I think they ended up trying too hard to please millennials and it just started to feel forced.  The food was decent, atmosphere is decent, it just felt too cliche for me and so we probably wont be back. Unless I need a cute avocado toast shot on my instagram.

ht_3hT63kQXfHPCmNcINVQ.text: Beautiful interior space and decor, and the food is okay. If you have any ounce of culinary skills, you can cook this type of simplistic food that resembles a meal plan. The food also reminds me of the Whole Foods prepared food section. I tried both the tofu and salmon plates, with a variety of sides like curried cauliflower, broccoli, spinach, and more. They are a bit heavy handed with the salt and seasoning as well.

ZQqnv1Gm7hZ5-YRMrJnueA.text: My mom and I love coming to Flower Child to grab a late lunch/ early dinner. Not only is the food delicious but also healthy! The portions are perfect and since you're getting quality food it leaves you full. My mom especially loves their specialty lemonades and fusion drinks. If you're looking for a cute brunch hangout spot or a yummy reward after a hard workout, eat here! It will not disappoint.

sSHpfWZ19Z0nfwcn9Gd75A.text: Cheers and more power to restaurants that offer healthy options that actually taste good!   When I try a place during their grand opening, I set low expectations and bump my patience level all the way up - I expect things to not go perfectly since they're working on kinks and all that. But Flower Child managed to pleasantly surprise me. They got their act together and things are going smoothly like a well-oiled machine. Service was fast and friendly. Food was delicious. The place was packed but no errors/ chaos occurred.  They have daily soup, salads, plates, bowls, wraps which you can add your favorite protein (chicken, salmon, grass-fed steak, or tofu) to. They have sweet treats as well. To drink, they have seasonal lemonade, iced tea, kombucha (on tap), wine, and beer.  Thai Cashew Quinoa with Salmon Bowl: My bowl came out smoking hot - I got a good facial. Very tasty Asian flavors with a bit of a kick from the jalapeno. Lots of textures and flavors. The salmon was nowhere dry or over cooked at all - it was perfection! 5/5  Spicy Japanese Eggplant, Sauteed Spinach + Grass-fed Steak Plate: With their plates, you can pick 1, 2 or 3 veg/ grains and add a protein. The steak is lean but tender and flavorful. The veggies were delightful with a bit of heat and refreshing tang. 5/5  Brownie: Gluten-free...I don't have celiac disease so, I'm not afraid/ avoidant of gluten. But if you do have celiac disease, this is the sweet treat for you! Good texture and very mo!$t. 5/5  Lemon Olive Oil Cupcake: Not only did we try 1 cupcake, we had to get a dozen! I've had lemon Olive oil cupcakes before that only have a hint of lemon and olive oil + regular oil - not good. These cupcakes were so good. Strong flavors. Sweet and savory at the same time. 5/5  Chocolate Chip Cookie: Another gluten-free item. Made with cashews, coconut and other ingredients without tasting too coconutty. Crunchy. 4/5  One of the highlights for me is their drink station. They have different kinds of teas and lemonades. They're all good and you can get creative by mixing different flavors.  They have neat wall murals, flowers, and little details such as a "yoga mat parking". So, after a good sweat sesh, this is a good spot to eat at with your gym squad.

EUQdYh60ySfmlS2b9cRYgA.text: I love this restaurant. I love the laid-back ambience and the warm feeling that the restaurant gives you. The menu is amazing with different varieties of healthy choices. One is as delicious, if not more, than the other. I love the Mediterranean salad... That is one of my favorite Mediterranean salads ever. The service is very friendly and you cannot go wrong with this place. You order at the counter and then you go sit down with a number at your table and the food is brought to you. You are not rushed and this place is great for families, including little kids whose parents are encouraging healthy eating, and great for friends and even couples. The prices are a little high but worth every penny. This is not a cheap place yet it is not exorbitantly high either. Highly recommended!

oRKNNy1AhTOOmwmnc-uTqA.text: Wow! This restaurant is amazing! And patio dining!  I do enjoyed it. Excellent food, service and ambiance!

yoSPqXkwdSaESvFu8HSmOg.text: I know everyone is raving about this place. It's one of those crunchy granola, hipster, millenial place to have some avocado toast in a hippy setting.   I didn't dislike it. But I can't say that I absolutely loved it either. I had the rice bowl and it was good and added steak. It wasn't bad. I just think for the price there's a lot of other places and things I'd rather eat. My daughters wanted to try it so we went.   One daughter had the skinny cob and loved it. My other daughter has the strawberry fields salad and liked it but the said she preferred cafe Zuppas salad...and my other daughter and I thought she was nuts. This was way more flavorful and who wants to repeat their order 50 times..this is better...order take a number--take it to the table and they Bring it there.   I would eat there again. Not sure if it's my first choice but I wouldn't be opposed to it.

7n72g7LCdmpYwoiOvZbTuA.text: Came here for lunch and got the lemonade and the Flying Avacado. The food was simply amazing. My fiance got the wild rice soup and it was really tasty as well. I love when I can eat, be full, and feel good about it. I will definitely come back here again.

Oo94J5l-0GagX2lpdE5zhw.text: I had really high hopes for this place- the decor is beautiful and the menu is nice flashy, but after eating there I'm a bit more than disappointed.   I shared the Bird Is The Word and gluten free mac and cheese when I brought my mother and while the mac and cheese was pretty good, the wrap was basic. Something I didn't expect was to feel very sluggish after eating since usually healthy foods make you feel better but perhaps that was just my experience. Furthermore, for the price of the food I was expecting more from my service than having to get my own forks, knives, napkins, and drinks. I suppose that's the theme of the restaurant but as much as the restaurant LOOKED like a luxury, the service was quick and impersonal. Not a total deal breaker, but you generally expect more from a restaurant in this area, especially given the other great spots just feet away.   Overall it feels like you're paying more for the kitsch of a cute healthy place with vegan options rather than an actual restaurant or even high end cafe. Good place but probably wouldn't go again, especially for such a hefty price tag (25$ for a wrap, drink, and side of mac and cheese).

B5PuCZoSXjiAN9jJVjMD7g.text: I like the idea of this restaurant. I dig counter style service.  It is visually appealing and very cute and well decorated, they offer a great variety of world flavors & colorful dishes ranging in salads, soups, clean protein options, the price point is very reasonable, the establishment is clean, as the employees are well groomed, young & kind.     I do feel indifferent about the quality of the food.  I can taste the emulsifiers used in many of their dressings, sauces, marinades.   As cute looking as this restaurant is i highly suspect they use a lot of preservatives, this place is a chain restaurant, deff not a scratch kitchen, I like my food to be cooked by people, not mix in ingredients in bowls with pre doctored sauces made for mass production.    For that, I could just stay at home & toss a Wal-Mart vegetable quality chopped salad w/ a pre made mix, which i never do.   I left today with a stomach ache but that's only because of sensitivety to gmos, sugars, guar gums & processed junk.     I probably won't come back here because I love organic, farm fresh food, i love real traceability in the food I eat.   I don't feel I get that from Flower Child.  This place is created to run like a well oiled machine, too corporate for me, i prefer to dine at mom & pops / sole proprieter restaurants that put True soul in their food. I wish Flower Child the best in it's endeavours, it's just not for me.

k9AAJtGRcnSyBcza3-5iJQ.text: Sooooo glad we have a Flower Child here in Vegas ! It's a cheaper alternative to most healthy-foodie places that can be so pretentious and expensive and sometimes just gross.  It really offers something for everyone from desserts to build-your-own plates to vegan offerings, to different types of cuisines. But you're f-ing up if you don't order the Thai eggplant and their kale salad with grapefruit and white cheddar at least once. Seriously. I tell people it is my favey fave salad in the city.  Get a drink and mix the teas together. Also their tofu is bitchin. Whatever witchcraft they are doing back there to make it so tasteyyyyy is working.

83ozuOQq2ZYnYirqFtefzw.text: So good. Decided on the 3 plate side. Indian spiced cauliflower, sauteed spinach, and the heirloom and watermelon. Can't wait to go back and try the Glow bowl.

rDff1SyCEI1KtqU1-PTsAw.text: This was my to go meal!  Most half ass order of food !  Totally surprised and pissed !

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XVbUBSyQwcJ4fVDyTrdGtw.text: Flower Child's Skinny Cobb is HANDS DOWN my favorite salad of all time. It's soooooo good. I don't even know how else to describe it:  The crunchy corn, fresh arugula, nuts, cucumbers...and gorgonzola dressing...all the flavors mix incredibly well! And it's healthy! Add some salmon/ chicken/ tofu/ steak to up the protein factor and it's a full on meal.   I've also had their Mother Earth Bowl, which is super yummy too! Veg friendly and packed with garlicky goodness. The broccoli pesto is awesome. It's earthy in all the good ways.   My only complaint is that the portion sizes are quite small, so without the additional protein, the salads and bowls are not a filling meal.   Decor is super fun and fresh. Service is friendly and efficient. You see alot of healthy and happy looking people here :)

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

11gs-J4m817FYcGwdgybvQ.text: Not sure how I feel about this place...  Love the decor and the overall feel of the place, very open and spacious, plenty of room for large groups which is a plus since a lot of the new and hippy places tend to be kind of small. Staff was friendly and food came out pretty quickly.    Came here with two friends and we got two salads, one wrap and two of the plates (3 items) to share and two teas and the bill was over $90. I get that their food is fresh and organic and all that but for that price we didn't feel like it was a satisfying meal. Most of the items tasted pretty good but portion was on the smaller side, even if you get a protein and three sides you might not be full. I like the concept, you can choose a protein and some sides to make a dinner plate but it just didn't do it for me.

X9BMOB_9OeA96H86YYW9CQ.text: This place was great loved the food. Service was great place is very clean and friendly. Highly recommend. We had two dish's one wrap and the other salad both with Tofu and we enjoyed both very much.

KJ3Ixq-VMSiDnkmFMCN_ZA.text: Normally I would give Flower Child 5 stars. I come here once a week after the gym because of the fact that it's casual, relatively quick and use of quality ingredients. The last few visits I've been dissatisfied. I ordered the Thai Cashew Quinoa and there weren't any cashews in the entree. Today I ordered my regular Kale Salad and it didn't come with the black currants or the smoked almonds.  It makes a big difference when key ingredients are left out of a entree. It's especially noticeable in something as basic as a salad. There should be communication between the kitchen and front of house so that they are able to inform customers of missing ingredients so they know what to expect, or at least have the opportunity to order something else. Just sharing constructive criticism in hopes of improving the experience.

oK9tr6QspdWJHhLnOU4bEg.text: Finally!!! Exactly the vibe we so needed in this town! I'll be back to try every single dish, promise!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_cAkvGYxyYYxT23SS9bIFg.text: Decided to try something new with a couple gf's & my mini me -- Flower Child was definitely a good choice. The decor is super cute & the place is very spacious. Of course, I went with the most basic and ordered the avocado toast & a Prosecco + Lemonade. My daughter had the kids meal -- she picked chicken, mashed potatoes & the fruits (strawberries, apples & clementines) and she had a Mango Pineapple Lemonade. When the food came out, I was a little shocked at the portions. I mean yes, I only got an avocado toast, but it was just so dainty. Anyway, my avo toast was very 'toasty' (overly crunchy), but the amount of avo & egg made up for the 'toasty-ness'. The Prosecco + splash of lemonade was spot on. On to my daughters meal -- she said her chicken was dry, but there was yummy flavor to it. She loved the fruits because they tasted fresh and sweet. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves & will be going back to try other things.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lbDdjeWcQVNnUf1UEKBzuw.text: Such a lovey change to the food scenery in Las Vegas. The menu has so many fresh, healthy options. The food is consistently good and it arrives at the tables fairly quick. It's a nice addition to the city, and we always enjoy our meals here.

6KX9d7tSv2WLPqsYJx7TTg.text: We were invited to check out this new gem prior to the opening. The environment was something that Summerlin has been lacking. We're vegan and we finally have somewhere to go with friends that might not be vegan. There are options for everyone including a very cool kids menu. Hats off to the friendly staff. The food, service and environment was an A+! We looking to frequent the Flower Child!

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9E9_mZVQ4sQznZ236Bha5A.text: I absolutely love this place. I take my girlfriend and my family here all the time. The food is great and very healthy. The atmosphere is super joyful and relaxing. If you are a vegan or vegetarian, welcome home. Enjoy!!!

V1SGk6R6NmVTUjybdZOMqA.text: Very impressive vegetarian food and drink.  Fast but casual gourmet veggies prepared in a creative manner.  Not a sit down type place until you place your order upon entry.  The bowls are gr8 and the salads are healthy and tasty.  Avocado toast also yummy.  A little loud but a delicious addition to the culinary scene.  Friendly service and good people watching.  Love the ice teas.

M7y3hpDieABVL3MXlzEc6A.text: This restaurant is so good!!! I would 100% come back again! There were so many delicious looking vegan and vegetarian dishes on the menu and I was able to narrow down my order to the Mother Earth bowl w/tofu (added proteins cost extra). I also had a rose lemonade with my bowl which tasted good but I couldn't taste the rose. The one downside to this place is that it gets very noisy if you choose to sit inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mother Earth bowl w/tofu and rose lemonade

U517nctY8TsqnvUTdMTmGw.text: Cool environment, gorgeous kitchen, and ingredients tasted fresh. The menu was pretty diverse, which is why myself (vegan) and boyfriend (basically a carnivore) came. We got there though and it was just so noisy inside that we couldn't hear each other. Would have been awesome on a day that you can sit outside, but for us the open kitchen and packed house was just a bit to much inside.

b094pmFBzjHVCqiUJ5GiLQ.text: Vegas needs more restaurants like this! Options for EVERYONE. Vegans, pescatarians, meat eaters and kids. I've had the vegan poke (many times) and the build your own plate with the glazed sweet potato and cauliflower. All amazing and 10/10. I wish they would work on flavoring their tofu a bit more. But many places don't so I won't knock a star down for that. Just a thought! Really busy during lunch and very instagram worthy for us millennials. I hope they bring a location to Henderson so I can stop driving so far for this place!   Also forgot to take a photo of my food. *fails at being a millennial*

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tg3eycX-BweaxCHXAHtqLw.text: I loved this place! Everything on the menu sounded like something I wanted to put in my belly, and as a picky vegetarian, that's saying a lot. My non-veg hubby liked it so much that he wants to eat here again on our way out of town. And we don't typically like repeating restaurants on vacation. Yum!

AtJ_I8MC2Ux1aXQzEppu6g.text: Delicious, healthy, fun atmosphere, and clean!! I highly recommend this restaurant. Kid friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LWWL0rK5qbIX_vfDdJMPgw.text: Delicious healthy options. Lots of options to choose from. Everyone got something different to share and it was all great. I had the chopped veggie salad which was really good but i will say the ginger dressing was a little overpowering. My only complaint

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LSREXrK_TD70IsouB4hD0w.text: This place awesome. Reasonably priced, well sourced food. The portions only look small, but are quite filling. The plates, like Japanese eggplant, curried cauliflower, spinach, and spice green beans are delicious (but definitely small...but delicious). Their wraps are killer, The Rebel especially. The variety of grains they cook with is also very refreshing, I think just the forbidden grain dish has three or four. Great atmosphere, great service. Clearly there's some pride put into everything done here.

CjFqhIQwaoJuwVPS0cMKMw.text: Went to the flower child on Saturday evening around 730pm. The place was busy but the service is really quick. They have kombucha tea on tap ($5) which I had to get. To be honest their grilled asparagus alone made me post this review and give hem 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ni3yAzDgo9jbOlPk87rqsg.text: Yummmmmmmmm. This place is so good! The gluten-free mac and cheese is to die for! It's healthy and delicious. Great that you can select items almost ala carte. I also love the ambiance, so cute and perfect for social photos. Great lunch spot, very relaxed and always good.

bQ0ZkmziXpeGKSYH5J-eeA.text: Really great atmosphere! The menu isn't super extensive, but you also have the freedom of creating your own combinations which is always nice. The portions aren't huge which is also a plus. Everything was fresh and delicious, but most of all super healthy. Its really nice to have dining options that cater to specialized diets. The staff was friendly, helpful, and welcoming!

guanw-X5jPGhdTqk_CPFpQ.text: The food here is very flavorful, as long as you don't come in close to closing time. If you come in within 45mins of closing you may get warm, OK tasting food. Also, to go portions are noticeably smaller than when you dine in.

Qy7px3UUWtzfzFNhfut_MQ.text: This is my second time visiting Flower Child. I had the vegan ramen which was very good, I just wished it came out a little warmer than it did. It was extremely busy during lunch hour on a Wednesday so I'm assuming it was probably that. Everything else was perfect, we were constantly checked on making sure all was ok. Flower Child is always on the top of my list of places to eat when looking for something healthy.

RxrIpUEFtY7uz0nJiGpKVQ.text: Well...I came here for lunch and dinner 3 consecutive times...I can tell you that I was satisfied. I don't think their pricing is bad at all compare to Panacea. It's healthy and they serve wine which is a plus! Haha I tried ordering different items at each time I've been here to see if they will keep up with the expectations. So far, everything I've ordered was great! You don't often find a healthy organic food with lots of flavor. This place is busy but you don't wait too long for your food to be served at your table. Will definitely keep coming back here!

AazvQaJx18mDIm4b9BSaaA.text: I loved this place a lot more than I thought I would.  Food was delicious and best of all, healthy.  The only drawback I found was that it is very noisy.  But if you are not trying to have an in depth conversation, you'll probably love the food!

b7B6ne-2HcH4ng_sjOrYQQ.text: Fresh concept, very earthy cute decor. Pricey to eat healthy but you get what you pay for! Got the vegan poke bowl and Mother Earth to go. $29 for lunch! Will dine in next time in town to enjoy the full experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Timely to go order. Was quoted the time it was ready.
Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan poke bowl with tofu

bz-DjBEranDr_6j2L3J-Cg.text: Been goin to the one in santa monica Was really excited when they opened it in las vegas  It's exactly the same quality  Super fresh food So yum ! And healthy ! Just like a meal prep  Made fresh for you in a restaurants vibe or take home and enjoy  5 stars

XzXuyAaKBwBRr2uBEo_30w.text: Food is good, not great. Wait staff/ atmosphere is on point though, and I enjoy working from here.

SLeq-gP53n_cAnYjh_x5xg.text: Food is great tasting and healthy not always an easy thing to do. We have never eaten at the restaurant but have been inside to get our take out order. Staff are nice and they have fruit water for you while you wait....nice touch especially in summer.

HmChL1uuGqU7Vmh63oHSyQ.text: Such a good place. Good variety on the menu with or without meat. They make vegetables taste so good! I usually order two entrees or small side plates to try everything. Save room for a lemon muffin when you're done.

MJMKCOLYbOXVUEFK5LmgyQ.text: This place is so cute ! The best Mac & cheese I've ever had and it was only $4. I haven't tried something I didn't like. Steak was amazing. Pretty much everything on the menu is healthy with a few exceptions. This place is my new addiction

XYZjmN64coMHbDQCMUtdHw.text: We loved the idea of having a healthy restaurant that served fresh food down the street from us. We had high hopes and we really wanted to like this restaurant. Unfortunately, the quality of food was good but it didn't meet our expectations. Maybe it was hyped up too much, but we genuinely wanted to enjoy flower child. When we arrived the place was packed. We decided to order the side of eggplant, broccoli, asparagus, and the avocado toast because we weren't too hungry. The sides were very small and they were $4 a piece which was a little pricey. I feel like I would have enjoyed it more if it wasn't so over priced. The avocado toast was pretty good other than the fact that the piece of toast that it was on was a little burnt but the toppings had a good flavor. The restaurant has a trendy feel and overall is beautiful. The service was outstanding as well but I wish we enjoyed the food a little more especially for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Flower Child - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uUcSN6i-CL4Pvg0gl9ahlw.text: Good prices great taste and great selections! Loved skinny Cobb, Vietnamese crunch and all the dressings! Steak and chicken quality is superb

Sb5HAI-OtczdJdmadQSTXw.text: The most two recent times I have visited Flower Child on rampart in Las Vegas Nevada I was extremely disappointed as they had run out of essential ingredients that are in many of their dishes. The first instance they had run out of avocado and asked me what they might replace the item with. I ask for bok choy as a replacement for the avocado. After picking up the order and returning home I realized there was no bok choy in the dish I had ordered. The most recent instance they were out of tofu. This time I decided to let a manager know that this was not the first time they had run out of seemingly essential ingredients. I spoke with the manager and she's recommended that I replace the tofu with another item that they had available. She offered to comp my meal to which I told her that was not necessary I just wanted to let her know that this was the second time in a row they did not have ingredients offered on the menu. She insisted to comp the meal and we agreed to replace the tofu with sauteed spinach. After driving home and unpacking the meal I realized that the sauteed spinach never found its way into the bag.  I called back to the same manager and she apologized that it was a mixup. Flower child does have pretty good food when they actually have the ingredients, however that seems to be very rare lately. Furthermore the forgetfulness of the staff and management is unbelievable.  They receive a 9 out of 10 on quality of food and a 3 out of 10 on customer service and information retention.

cmY5-56XM1uxWo27orHnyQ.text: While I haven't personally eaten here my 17 year old daughter loves it!  I'm eager to try it out.

6T-UVvKUvX6kznc3TbKGPw.text: Awesome place! A little pricey for me to be a regular but enjoy the food every time I go. I recommend try a new item with each visit. The flavors explode with eat bite! Your taste buds will thank you!

sgf740aCZIuNWk4AZmSMIw.text: This place has a really nice ambiance and great outdoor patio.  Though expected in the Summerlin area, I find the prices are too steep for what you get.  Food is fine.

ab528E-VGj6-ZeMjsL1Y8A.text: Very good gourmet fast food alternative, eat here all the time when I'm in the area and want to get in and out fast. Everything on the menu is real good,and everyone is friendly.

gUrcacmSXGcHFwwXfXgTMA.text: Just a fantastic healthy meal.  It's only been open a few weeks and already the lines are out the door for both sit down and takeout on a normal Monday afternoon.  I ordered a forbidden rice salad with added tofu.  Large and full of different vegetables which made it nothing basic.  I saw broccoli and green beans and many other colorful fillings with additional jalapeno to spice it up.  Though it wasn't spicy whatsoever, it was still a nice dish to get the afternoon rolling.  The tofu was grilled nicely and tasted fresh.  Some of the better looking tofu I've had and presented well even at takeout where it was sliced thin and layed on top of the forbidden rice.Inside is pretty, kind of a sleek brunchy vibe.  Plenty of parking available and service was very fast with a takeout order called and picked up in less than 15 minutes, even during the rush of lunch.  Very impressed by Flower Child and will be back.  More of a higher end price-wise, at $14 for my salad with additional tofu, but well worth it for quality and taste.

eruJtTBzuCw7tu1tYnlA9Q.text: When this place first opened I was there EVERYDAY, literally for 2 weeks straight food was great. I went in recently and ordered my usual and it was such a disappointment. It tasted like crap and it looked rushed. when I complained the employee told me sorry the trainers left that's probably when you enjoyed your food. I told them they can keep my money they probably needed it more than I do and left pissed!!!!

FoedMmzogfWIVwzOSva8dQ.text: If you like healthy food this isn't the place . If you like good food this isn't the place . They have failed miserably . Toast was hard plain piece of bread with avacado on top . Eggs made with water salmon is pre frozen broccoli as well . Wouldn't recommend this to a dog .

vBjvnAwI8k1cr1btBsMhnw.text: Great ambiance and yummy, healthy food!  Had the avocado toast - delish.  Watermelon and heirloom tomato salad - the portion on that was small, but it was tasty.  And the asparagus - cooked to perfection!  Staff was helpful, it was clean and I will definitely be back!

KManZ4JZ8GYHG6_ajJVM4g.text: Great food and unique, great flavor combinations.  Very nice environment.  Will definitely be back.
